title: Near the station and that’s about it
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: A dated property , which although clean is mediocre in most respects. Getting a cup of coffee at breakfast is a gamble, the rooms are down rambling corridors and I did wonder what I would do should there be a fire. Rooms were clean but dated.  Breakfast had tinned fruit...do I need to say more? The location is however very convenient both for the tram to the airport and the railway station.. mind you in Florence one spends very little time in the hotel room so this hotel may suit some.

title: My poorest accomodation experience in Italy
review: We stayed for 3 nights. The staff were helpful and polite, room was clean and comfortable, the hotel is very centrally located and easy to walk to all the attractions. The bed was comfortable however the pillows are a bit flat, maybe could ask for an extra pillow! The breakfast was adequate but not great, enough to get us started for the day though. For what we paid, we are really happy with the hotel.

title: Dated hotel
review: Where do I start? Upon arrival, I had no towels in my rooms. Had to ask for it twice, was dismissed by the 2nd individual because it was ‘too late for service’ and had to find a cupboard some out myself  The bed was umcomfortable. I was bitten by bugs, not sure if they were mozzies or bed bugs. The noise insulation was terrible, I could hear the entire conversations of my neighbours.   Breakfast is very average. The saving grace of the place was good brewed coffee. However, I had to wait for 45mins on one day and was almost late for my tour.   Overall, less than pleasant attitude by the staff. I constantly made to feel like I was causing an inconvience whenever I had to ask for milk for my coffee or asked the receptionist to about where to explore or confirmed my booked tours for me.   Upon check out, I was told that they only accepted cash for tourist tax even though they had facilities for credit cards. It would have been nice if I was informed about that anytime in my 3 days stay there. And I was charged an extra 1 euro for paying with credit card which is not standard practice. This dishonesty is disappointing.   It’s a shame because my experience in Florence has been tinted by the experiences at the hotel and I would have definitely had a more pleasant time elsewhere. In conclusion, I would definitely be choosing another hotel in future.…

title: loss personal belonging in the room
review: The hotel was close to the train station which was convenient however we didn’t enjoy much else about our stay.   The hotel was very dated and our room smelled of block drains. The bathroom door needed pulling closed every time and it’s likely the room next door heard. The toilet had a weird flush. Both of us had to turn the shower off mid-shower in order to let the water in the tray drain away.   Breakfast was basic.  Wouldn’t recommend.

title: BAD EXPERIENCE
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. title: Good location and that is it...
review: Someone broke my zip of suitcase and stole my Thai money(=euro285), BOSE Soundsport, a ring with one set of earring from Burano Island.  While the door-knob of the room is fine. I asked the manager to talk with the housekeeper who cleaned my room. Not only he did as my request, he invited us to move off if we, I and my friend, do not sure about their security.  The conversation was very bad so I tried to record his word.  His worker saw my mobile and told him. He stopped talking and waited until I stopped recording. He threatened me to give him my mobile if I do not he will call a police. I was glad if he did but he just lied us.   We tried to notify the police but one station was closed and another infom us to go to another station because they did not concern about this case. …

title: Excellent location and basic service
review: The hotel has an excellent location, being at 2 minutes walking from the tram for and to the airport and at maximum 10 minutes walking from the main attraction - the doumo :) The staff are very nice but the building is very old. We were disappointed by the aspect of the rooms - very old and dark...but especially by the bathroom: the shower didn't have a tub or some glass around it so the water was everywhere...the other surprise that we had: the bathroom had a direct door to the main hall of the floor...very strange... The breakfast is poor... I will not recommend it.

title: Charity conference
review: We chose this hotel because of the excellent location within 5 mins walk from Florence SMN Train Station which is easy for us to travel to Pisa, San Gimignano and Cinque Terre. Florence is basically a walking city as all the top attractions are within walking distance. There are many eateries around especially along the hotel, there are quite a few of Chinese and Asian restaurant which is good to settle our cravings for Asian food. Room size is okay for us and hotel did help us to arrange take away breakfast due to our super early schedule. However, no drinks or drinking water for takeaway since they only have dispenser for drinks without any bottled drinks. Hot shower heater seems inconsistent and the front desk staff were not so friendly/ helpful, but smooth check-in and…

title: Lovely Location
review: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2019 and it was a great little basic hotel. Friendly helpful staff that were willing to help in any little way to make the stay more comfortable. Location was very central and we could walk round loads of the beautiful Florence sites. For my first trip to Italy it helped a lot and defintely made me want to return.

title: Exelent location, great service
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Handy location and good amenities
review: Ok for the price, location is fantastic, convinient garage next door, great and helpfull service (Andrea  is the best ever), lobby is nice, rooms are clean, but somehow you feel in your room that belongs in cartoon not in same hotel you entered- lol You have shower and bed and place to keep your staff, and do not expect more... Would be so nice if they deside to renovate rooms..... same storry in Paris and Rome.. Breakfast was okeish, again, good service cover everything else

title: Conveniently located
review: We're five New Zealanders who stayed two nights in early June and had three rooms (two couples and a single) . Staff were amazing and even swapped rooms after check in for one of our group who had terrible jetlag so he could be away from any street noise and sleep peacefully. Although you don't even hear the street from the 4th floor! The hotel is clean and although somethings are a little worn it is mainly due to how popular it is (we noticed a lot of Italians on business stay here which was comforting). Security is good and we never felt unsafe leaving our key at reception. It is located 5mins walk from the Napoli Centrale train station which was great when arriving, leaving and popping to Pisa for a half day. There's a fun market at the end of the street with great leather…

title: Good for the price
review: I stayed here recently as part of a larger group (an adult with a college tour). The hotel is a short walk from the train station, and is conveniently located. You can walk to just about anywhere in Florence in 15 minutes or less (often times much less). The hotel is an older building, but it works. A few things that might be worth noting, as it is not a chain hotel (so therefore don’t expect the same generic experience):  1: I had room 402, which overlooks the street. There are NO window screens, so you can literally open the windows as wide as you want. There is no “safety” mechanism-so if you lean out too far-you’ll fall directly onto the pavement below. I personally enjoyed the freedom of opening the shutters and windows and getting the cool breeze at night. Plusses: this…

title: Ok hotel
review: Thank you for the kind review, it was a pleasure having you here. We try to improve every day in order to make our Clients stay as pleasant as possible.  Hope to see you again. Regards,

title: It was the perfect hotel.
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. title: Needs renovating
review: It was the perfect hotel. I will also use this hotel if I go to Florence.  · The staff greeted me with a smile and the check-in procedure was completed in 1 minute. Also taught me a delicious shop nearby. · You can arrive from the station in 5 to 8 minutes on foot, and there are many restaurants around the hotel · The facilities of the room were fulfilling, and cleaning was also solid. I got tired after bathtub was soaked whole body. · Departure date was free and kept baggage  パーフェクトなホテルでした。 フィレンツェに行くならまたこのホテルを利用します。  ・スタッフの方が笑顔で迎えてくれてチェックインの手続きは1分で完了。近くの美味しいお店も教えてくれました。 ・駅から徒歩5〜8分で到着でき、ホテルの周りには飲食店が多い ・部屋の設備も充実していて、掃除もしっかりされてました。バスタブは全身浸かれたので、疲れがとれました。 ・出発日も無料で荷物を預かってくれました

title: Nice, comfortable, clean, great location..
review: Thankyou so much ! we do appreciated .... best regards  cristina

title: Italian hospitality
review: Hotel is in a good location but is in need of a complete renovation and new furnishings, it’s tired and run down. Staff were very helpful though. It’s walking distance to the railway station and all major attractions in the city.

title: Comfortable stay
review: We stayed here for 2 nights.  The hotel is located within 5 minutes walk from S.M Novella station, there are plenty of eateries and shops around and a supermarket just 50m away.  We easily walked to the Duomo, uffizio gallery and ponte vecchio, all within walkable distance.  The room was reasonably spacious and was cleaned every day, beds were comfy just a bit of noise from adjacent rooms but not so disturbing.  Breakfast was good, coffe needs to be requested but they bring it to the table.  WIFI was reliable most of the time.  All staff day/night were friendly and helpfull  I would definitely stay here again

title: Perfect Hotel, clean rooms - New towels every day. Simple but good breakfast- Nice staff- open 24h - in centre
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. title: Disappointing - especially the leaky roof
review: Allthough the shower is a bit small(i am 1.90mtr), the bathroom was complete! New towels every day and they even make up your bed!  The hotel is in the old centre, 3 min walk from the main treinstation . Friendly people! Breakfast was the same every day but good enough.  We recommend you to go there!! Price is good for wat you get!

title: Decent stay and experience
review: I stayed here with my 2 children for 2 nights at the beginning of August. We booked a triple room through booking.com however due to a mix up we were initially allocated a double room. The hotel contacted us back in November to ask if we wanted to upgrade to which I agreed. However upon check in it was clear this had not been done. However after a word with reception we were able to change rooms to a triple as requested. On the surface the new room appeared ok. However on our 2nd day in Florence there was a thunder storm with very heavy rain. We were out of the hotel at the time but when we returned the carpet in our room was soaking and our suitcases had been moved. The clothes inside the suitcases, some books and the suitcases themselves were soaking. We had not totally…

title: Absolutly recommendable
review: Dear Sir/Madam,  first of all, thank you for the review. The booking made was for a double room, you've made a request for the third bed so the cost of €60,00 was not for an upgrade but for the third person. It's true that the heavy rain caused several unpleasant difficulties, but it wasn't just your room, it was interested the entire part of that floor, we had to move 4 rooms, a custumer made us aware of the situation so it wasn't something that we knew before. Our employees apologized for the inconvenience and did their best to minimize the gravity of the situation.  Best Regards, Hotel San Giorgio

title: Great stay, great location near train station
review: First of all, let us be clear. This is a 3 star hotel and is exactly that. We were there for 2 nights of 6th and 7th July 2018. The hotel is very very near the Florence train station - walkable in 5 minutes! It is bang in the middle of the city centre, and so once you are checked-in, getting around town on foot is a breeze - the Duomo, for example is literally 5 min on foot! That is the biggest plus point of the hotel. The rooms are adequate - not too big, not too small. Our room was, however not big enough to open 2 suitcases at once :-) The food - breakfast, in our case, was adequate. The rooms do not have coffee-tea makers, so remember to take it along!

title: Great location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. title: Very close to train station, only thing got going for it sadly
review: We found this hotel to be in a great location and great value for money. The staff were amazingly helpful and sought to assist us whenever we asked for anything. The rooms aren't amazing, but neither are you paying amazing prices. The breakfast was adequate, again not great - but neither is the price. It certainly worked for us.  We were on the 1st floor so used the stairs except when taking luggage up or down. We really enjoyed our time in Florence and if we were looking for a budget hotel in a great location, we would certainly come back to this hotel.   Luca from the front desk was amazingly helpful and gave great advice in terms of where to eat and how to get to different places we wanted to go to. Big shout out of thanks to Luca.

title: Great location
review: I paid an absolute bomb for this hotel after “upgrading”’from a previous hotel which was booked ages ago which had very bad reviews.... the pics are so deceiving... and other than the close proximity to everything it’s not worth the money I paid.  Staff are mostly friendly except one youngish fellow who was rather gruff when we were leaving.  Checking out took ridiculously long as the young girl there must not know how to do necessary tax payments so we were left waiting until gruff guy was free... meanwhile times a ticking and we had s train to catch.  Anyway to say I was disappointed is an understatement...  Pros: clean, tidy, hot water (takes a few minutes but once it gets going is very hot) Air Cond works super well.. we had a quad room so was kinda spacious, beds were…

title: Bad experience, really NOT a 3-stars hotel!
review: Dear Sirs,  thank you for reviewing our hotel. I'll start by specifying that we don't know exactly how much you've paid for the room, we have a contract with the agency your booking came through and the rates are fixed throughout the year. About the check out, there were other people before you, three couples to be exact, we understand that you had a train to catch but one has to prepare itself accordingly. The young girl is an intern from a local school, she just started that week and she is still learning obviously. Our hotel is an historical building inside the historical city centre, most hotels don't even have a lift and the speed of it it's subjective, as it is the aboundance of choice of the breakfast. The street is a quiet one, no pubs around and just a few cars during the day, almost none in the night.  We will take in good consideration all your suggestions. Best Regards

title: Great location, spacious rooms, good breakfast
review: Stayed 3 nights here. Extremely close to train station. Staff friendly. 5 floors of rabbit warden. Not sure how you would get out in an emergency. We had breakfast included, but only bothered with it for the first day, pretty minimal continental breakfast provided. Appears to have a shortage of table knifes, have to wait till waite brings you one but there are plenty of forks and spoons.  Weird set up with room keys, you leave your key with reception as you leave the hotel. They never checked our ID on our return to get Our key, we could have asked for any key.

title: Good stay.. close to Train station
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. title: Close to train station
review: Overall a very good stay.. breakfast was not so good(no options for Indians and Veggies)  Wi-Fi was at its high speed.. walkable distance to Train station.. Good surrounding environment..  helpful staff at reception..

title: Cheap  Hotel, well situated
review: Easy walk from and to train station. Although the room was a little dated in decor, it was clean and bed comfortable.   Our bathroom was a great size, not too small.  Breakfast was good with several cereals, yogurts, croissants, meat, cheeses and great coffee. The gentleman who checked us in was very helpful at marking a map for us to guide us on a walking tour of the biggest sites to see.  I would stay here again.

title: Considerate venue
review: grazie infinite! saluti cristina

title: Average Hotel
review: This  hotel is situated  near the bus station. Just up the road there  is an excellent  market selling leather goods and  further on a nice square with  several  very good restaurants. We liked our room, taking the  lift  upstairs  but  walking  down! Their little lounge is  very useful  for  relaxing or  meeting the  group  at the start of the  day.

title: "Nice traditional italian hotel"
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. title: What a Joke
review: A charming hotel in the heart of the center of Florence.Nice ,clean rooms, friendly staff, vintage fernitures.Its very close to Piazza Duomo, to S.Maria Novella and to cental train station. Highly recommended!!!

title: Beware of thefts!
review: Do not go here. The rooms are tiny. The wifi doesnt work. The beds are hard. No room to wash in bathroom. Staff unapproachable. There is a lift but there are still 6 steps to get your bag into the room. Does have nice lounge. Go somewhere else it will be worth the extra.

title: Great Location, but dated interior
review: My son stayed in the San Giorgio Hotel for a weekend this summer with a group of students. After checking in on Friday afternoon, he left his backpack in the room. When he returned a couple hours later, he could tell that someone had gone through his backpack, but since none of his electronics or other valuables were missing, he didn’t alert anybody about it. However, the next morning, he realized that an Under Armor golf shirt was missing from his backpack. As he thought there might be a small chance that his memory was mistaken about packing it, he did not report the theft until after he left Florence and confirmed that the shirt was indeed missing.  When he contacted the hotel, the hotel management denied that the shirt could have been stolen and was unhelpful in resolving…

title: Nothing Special
review: So geographically the location is perfect. very close to the train station, and a very short walk from the Duomo and the rest of the city centre. However, it is on the back-alley to a main market, so through the night there was often shouting from foreign traders.  Interior was very dated. Floors creaked, bathroom was very shabby and rattled a lot. Very old fashioned décor. However it had a very nice lounge downstairs. And Wi-Fi was painfully slow, and signal in my room was patchy.  Staff were very helpful, particularly when I was after a trip to Monteriggioni. They were very helpful in finding me the perfect tour.

title: Great location and lovely staff
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Lovely hotel
review: I really liked this hotel. The building is old and a bit dated but the room is clean and there is a lot of space. There is air conditioning that works really well which was a definite must as it was very hot! Breakfast was included and had a selection of breads, pastries, some cheese, meat, butters plus coffee, tea and juice. The staff were very nice and helpful.   Florence isn't a big city but it was close to everything and near the train station too. Easy enough to walk to the main sights or to find a restaurant.

title: Clean, comfortable and helpful staff
review: Nice and efficient staff, a short walk from the train station and a 10 to 15 minutes walk to most attractions. The room was very pleasant, nice bathroom, very clean but the bed could have been more comfortable, joint twin beds that were sliding apart. We were very happy with our choice, and for the Chinese among us it is next to some of the best Chinese food options in town

title: No hot water or working toilet
review: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in June 2017. Room was clean with old fittings. Breakfast was basic compared to other Italian hotels. Big shout out to Luca who was extremely pleasant and helpful with his suggestions and local knowledge

title: Charming & well run
review: There was no hot water in my bedroom. My friends in another room said they had a but but it was lukewarm.   My toilet did no flush.  Breakfast was very boring.  Positives: very well located - close to the cathedral and very close to the train station , and Friendly staff

title: a fantastic stay
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Adequate
review: The hotel is not a 5 star but it is a very nice place to stay and it is near the train station which is a plus for us as we travel by train when we visit Europe and the United Kingdom.  The breakfast is very substantial and presented well.  This is our second time to stay here and will stay here the next time we are  in Florence.

title: The Tourist's Choice
review: Hotel was fine, staff were absolutely wonderful, couldn't do enough and appreciated guests trying to speak Italian. Hotel Probably needs updating but it's an old building in an old city and it needs to keep some of its authentic Italian feel, dark furniture, curtains etc and it would be a mammoth task to revamp plus and it would increase the prices. Wi-fi worked for me whenever  I needed it. Bed was comfy, bathroom ok, shower needed a shelf to put toiletries on though, but no big deal. Cleaners did a fantastic job each day. All in all we had a nice stay and would go back

title: Stayed at better
review: This review is for all those who want to explore Florence and who view accommodation as a place to rest, refresh and replenish. If you are that kind of tourist, then San Giorgio would fulfill your needs.   The charm of this hotel, for me, was it's proximity not only to the station, the hop on facilities, the bus and taxis, but also  tourist sights, including the Duomo.   If you arrive at Firenze, the station, with your heavy luggage and you find yourself a bit disorientated because your google street map is not working and you're trying to figure out exactly where your hotel is, relax. Don't get a taxi, you'll pay 12 Euros or more. The San Giorgio is in 3 Via S. Atonino, across the road left to the Grand Hotel. About 3 minutes walk, traffic allowing. There's also a market…

title: The average hotel with decent facilities
review: This hotel, although supposedly a three star rating, is very, very basic.  No thrills at all.  The hotel could do with a but updating.  Rooms had a hairdryer/fridge and TV but could not get any English channels on it.  There is no bar at the hotel.  Breakfast is okay if you like cold.  Only cereals were cornflakes or a very sweet granola, they did not even do toast!  A member of my party asked for a poached egg and was told no they did not cook food, hence no evening meals available, although in Italy I would say that this is not a problem. Staff are extremely friendly and very helpful.  Could not fault them, although on one morning we came down to find a Concierage being shouted at by the owner which is not a good thing to do in front of guests.  The towels and rooms were…

title: Perfect location for every thing
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Disappointing after reading other reviews
review: This is a very nice small hotel set on a narrow street off the Piazza dell'Unità Italiana square, and very close to the main Santa Maria Novella train and bus stations. The staff are very friendly and full of information about local happening. Our room was pleasant with a view of the house tops below, unfortunately the bathroom was very small. Continental breakfast is served in a bright cheery room and is ampule, Upon leaving the Hotel turn left and continue down the narrow San Antonino street after about a hundred yards you will see on your left a small restaurant and butchers shop called La Padellaccia. This family owned and run business is the closes you are going to get to traditional Italian home cooking. If you continue to walk on, you will run into the Cathedral di Santa…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Stayed as a family of 3 for 4 nights.  Our daughter was 7 months old.  Our experience was not like some of the other reviews!  I'll start with the Good points, close proximity to the train station, clean, has wifi in rooms.    If you don't want any more than that, stay here.  My husband and I have travelled extensively as a couple and if it were just us with a couple of backpacks, this would have been adequate.  Even though a travel cot was provided, I would not stay here again with a baby.  Hotel itself has a lovely old charm but very scruffy.  Could do with a lot of TLC.  Our room was Bleak -  No pictures on the walls, old worn furniture, a bathroom that desperately needed replacing and a broken wardrobe.  Shower was only ever lukewarm.  No safe in the rooms - you have to use…

title: Great stay at a great place
review: Near the Train Station Santa Maria Novella, this hotel provides a friendly and helpful services and advices for its customers. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The breakfast was great. The room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the dome of the Duomo as i stayed in a double bed single room. The price is agreeable as well. Internet also worked well. I will return again.

title: Small but clean hotel at a nice location
review: We stayed at San Giorgio for 4 nights and we really enjoyed it. The Hotel itself looks very well maitained and matches the grandeur of the city. Staff were all very helpful and always willing to provide information and breakfast was fresh and sufficient to start your day in a good mood; extra points for the fresh Italian coffee. Location is absolutely fantastic, you can go everywhere on foot as it is only 2-3 minute walk from the Duomo. Definitely recommended and hopefully we visit Florence again.

title: Really loved staying here.
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Family room- ideal for a family of four!!
review: Clean and heated rooms, great location, good breakfast, free wifi. The place has a very charming atmosphere and makes you feel at home. We were very happy with this hotel for the price we payed and definitely recommend it to anyone who is visiting Florence.

title: Really close to all the sights
review: I stayed one nifty at St Gorgeo & Olimpic hotel for one night on our way to Rome from Venice. We found the room very neat and tidy. Reception was good and friendly. We had apeacefull stay. However, we thought the fee for overnight parking was bit too much.

title: Small but cute...
review: Dear Client,  thank you for the kind review and hope we'll have you again as our guest.  Best Regards.

title: Florence should be good but not so.
review: This is a clean central and accessible hotel. It has a good breakfast and good space in the room. Its really close to the train station and market. It was an enjoyable and restful stay. The lounge space is lovely and offers a home from home feel.

title: Good Hotel; Excellent Location

Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great location
review: We stayed 4 nights at The San Giorgio e Olimpic Hotel which is in an excellent position. being within approx 5 minute walk to  Stazione SMN & Bus pick-up points . It is also within an easy 20 minute walk to many of the major attractions such as: The Duomo; the Central Markets; The Galleria dell Accademia; The Ponte Vecchio  & central business area to name just a few.   The Desk Managers/concierge were friendly & most helpful treating us like family. Maps, tour bookings & free WiFi was available at the front desk. (We had no trouble using the WiFi in our room). We also liked the guest /waiting room with its comfortable armchairs & decor that looked most inviting whenever we entered the hotel.  A lift is available alongside the stairway. The room was a bit on the small size but…

title: Don't be fooled by their photos
review: I stayed here for 3 nights while attending a conference within walking distance. It is very well located, close to the train station, and I walked to sites including Uffizi and Galleria dell'Accademia. The rooms were clean and functional, and my particular room was quiet. The breakfast buffet was nice (cereal, breads, cold cuts, cheese, hard boiled eggs, peaches/prunes, other baked goods) and the service was friendly. But I can imagine some of the rooms may be noisy. I think it was a bit expensive for what you get, but this might be due to the prices in Florence. The first day the water in the shower was not quite hot.

title: First visit to Florence
review: We stayed for 3 nights. True the location is good but that's about all this hotel has going for it.  The problems were many and varied from no tv signal, substandard plumbing..... toilet runs non stop, toilet cistern vibrates LOUDLY during the night ...... shower water stops mid shower ..... surprisingly it has 3 stars???

title: Above average
review: We stayed here for four nights.  Hotel is in a great location, few minutes walking distance from Stazione di Santa Maria Novella. Staff were generally very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was simple. Walking distance to Mercato Cantrale and Duomo.

title: Tired hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: First visit to Florence
review: The hotel is in a great location and the staff were generally very friendly and helpful but a renovation is long-overdue./ The bedrooms are poor at best and some woefully inadequate even at 3star level. The website photos flatter. Pity as it could be so good but disappoints.

title: One night stay
review: Thank you so much to all the staff at San Giorgio, our room was superb, shower good and balcony overlooking Duomo brilliant! We returned daily to a freshly cleaned room, fresh towels and bedding. Water was always hot. Breakfast was ample and enjoyable. Reception staff could not have been more helpful. Location of the hotel was 5 minutes from the station ideal for train to airport and day trips. Given the chance we would return tomorrow!!! Florence is absolutely beautiful and the hotel was the icing on the cake! Thank you for an amazing time.

title: One night in Florence
review: We had just one night in Florence, so we booked this hotel because it was not very expensive and was very close to the train station. It is an old and tired hotel with a man at the reception who wrote our names in a huge registration book. We were thinking we'd have a retro experience but we didn't get it neither. The breakfast was not the best for sure. Anyway, going to Florence again I would  look for another hotel.

title: Room 115
review: The hotel is located a few steps from the main train station and just less than 10 minutes away from the city center. Many stores and restaurants in the area. Very safe. I was in Italy for work by myself and the room I was assigned was a double with a balcony with view, on the third floor. However there was music coming from the local bar nearby until midnight. The room was clean but not very large. The bathroom was clean but the door of the shower was broken.  Breakfast was good.  All the staff were friendly and nice.

title: Did the Job
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good hotel at the right place
review: This is a basic B&B short stay hotel. Standard rooms over five floors served by one five person capacity lift. Although during our stay the hotel was full you did not get the impression that it was over crowded. Breakfast was continental style and plentiful. Staff members are friendly and helpful with a good command of English. Trips can be booked in reception and city maps are freely available. The hotel is sighted a short walk away from the train and bus station, with the main tourist sights within easy walking distance.

title: Worst experience
review: Nice enough room, excellent location if arriving by train - pretty much across the road, and a 5 min walk to the centre.   Paid less than £70 per night which was very reasonable in August but saw this hotel quite a bit more expensive at many websites. If I had paid £100+ would've rated this hotel lower.  Room was spacious which a good sized bathroom. Colour theme very yellow!  Breakfast average, no hot food although service was good.  Happy to store luggage before check in and after check out.

title: Noisy
review: We had 4 nights here and constantly debated to leave or not. Room 106 was dirty and old. Crome on taps and fonts all worn away. Bed uncomfortable and mattress did not fit base. Breakfast don't bother it is dismal and depressing. Old band aide under the bed, we accidentally spilt soft drink mopped it up floor was not washed for the entire time. Disgusting place. Only good thing is location and near a laundrette nearby. You can do better

title: Terrible
review: The hotel said it has non-smoking rooms, but during my stay it was the opposite: all rooms were smoking rooms. I had 2 twin bed, but i booked double bed. In addition, the room next to the elevator and stairs allows to know all the movements of the neighbors ...

title: Good hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Don't understand why this hotel has 3 stars
review: Very good hotel to stay in florence. The staff and the reception men were friendy, the breakfast was good. It has very good location near to the train station, the markets and the dome. we enioyed our stay there and in florence

title: Enjoyed my stay
review: When we checked in the man in the reception wanted to keep our passports for a while for registration. When we protest against that he was laughing and told us that was the normal procedure instead of respect our feelings and doing the registration immediately. In The Netherlands there are a lot of warnings never to give your passport because of identity fraud. Only show it and let them write the number.  Our room (107) was a deception, nothing to do with a 3 star hotel. Except the good bed, everything was old and some things even broken. The door to the badroom was rotten and didn't close well anymore. Some plates of the old ceiling were broken and in the hall of our floor the door of the electrical box was half open, couldn't close anymore, dangerous if you are there with kids…

title: Loved my Florence experience!
review: I have just come back from 3 nights stay, had a wonderful time, hotel perfectly placed and our room (407) was lovely it had a small balcony which looked out over the rooftops with a view of the domes, a small bathroom with a lovely shower which helped cool us down as well as air con. I was staying with my daughter who is a coeliac and she was given gluten free breakfast each morning also the coffee was perfect. The hotel was a short walk from everywhere and we enjoyed wandering the narrow streets discovering the beautiful Florence.....we will return and thank you

title: Nice hotel with good location
review: I traveled with my adult daughter to Florence, and we stayed 3 nights in the San Giorgio e Olimpic Hotel. The location is great - very close to the S.M.N. train station. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. I can definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers!

title: Typically Italian romance
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Location location location!!!
review: My husband arranged this holiday for a surprise birthday treat and asked for a room with a view and a balcony.  The staff were extremely friendly and pointed out that they have given us what we had requested.  The room was a little small with ensuite bathroom which was a little small too.  There was one wardrobe to put clothes in and some bedside tables but not drawers to put clothes into.  We were only there for 4 days so we managed, if we had been there longer I think we would have struggled.  We opened the window onto a large balcony with a table and chairs that need a little bit of tlc. Because we were on the 4th floor we had lovely views out into a town area and over to one of the domes and towers so all in all it was a lovely view.  The room was what we asked for, it was…

title: Perfect location
review: The hotel is an excellent location to railway station. Easy walking distance to nearby restaurants, piazzas, markets, hop on hop off bus stop and meeting point for day tours. Reception is well organized and helpful with map on your arrival and pointing out places of interest.

title: Well located hotel let down by the poor condition of the bathroom
review: Stayed here with my sister for one night in May and it is in the most perfect location. The hotel is quite charming with a pretty old feel to it. The staff were very pleasant and  the room was clean and the breakfast was good. I would stay here again if visiting Florence.

title: Quaint
review: We chose this hotel because it was close to the train station. The room was fine but the bathroom was terrible. There was a putrid smell from the bathroom and the shower screen door was broken. We asked for the door to be fixed and the smell to be dealt with but neither were attended to during our stay despite follow up. Bleach was poured down the drain to mask the smell but this did not solve the issue. It made staying here very unpleasant.

title: Good location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: The dirtiest hotel
review: Very near to station ,just walking distance .All tourist places like domb ,church very near to the location . Very friendly Hotel staff near .Florence is very beautiful city and the hotel is very traditional Italian style .Good property for stay

title: Quaint, Good Value
review: I was with my family in room 227 on 4&5 April. I must say that this is the most disappointing hotel I ever stayed. The staff is ok. There is no safety box in the room. The carpet in the room was unbelievably dusty and we all got sick by 5th. Bed spreads are very old and bathroom is equipped with very low quality items. Commode sheet is worn out already and  Flusher is not working too. The walking areas are all full of dust and with old carpets. If you open the windows you can see just windows of the other building that are really unpleasant. Breakfast is just ok but not much variety at all. Not toaster nor bread. Wifi is not working in upstairs and you have to be in the old shaggy lobby area to use wifi. Only pros is the location.

title: Hotel with Heart
review: The staff were friendly and the free breakfast is wonderful. The location is very close to the train station, which is great for travelers with a tight timeline. The rooms are small but sufficient. My only negative: the wifi is a bit spotty. Overall, would definitely recommend.

title: Great location- with chinese food
review: What this property is lacking with modern amenities and new renovations it makes up for and even surpasses with the genuine intention of their staff to make your stay a truly great one. The moment you step into the San Giorgio, you know you are vicariously experiencing a little slice of mid 20th-century European charm, long before the days of the Internet and cheap international travel. From the extremely heavy key to the cozy sitting room and fireplace to the breakfast area and then into the room and bathroom you feel like you've stepped back into time in the nice, nostalgic kind of way. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly, you really feel like they will do all they can to make your stay in Florence an extremely memorable one. On our first day, I asked about what a…

title: Very good value for money Hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Decent hotel!
review: This is a very decently priced hotel a couple of hundred metres away from S Maria Novella train station within walking distance to major sights.  Decent breakfast, very clean rooms and very friendly staff.  Cosy lounge with fireplace.  Look out for Luca the receptionist and Gianpiero at the breakfast room.  I do not have the names of the other staff members but they were all very decent .  This is not the Ritz but you get very much what you are paying for.  This was our second visit and we plan to go again.

title: Stayed for 4 nights. Centrally located. Station near by. City attractions and many restaurantswere in walking distance.
review: Nice centrally located hotel! Very close to the main railway station that is Santa Maria Novella railway station! Around 5 minutes walk!  We were there for a night ! We were 6 adults and a child and we had 3 rooms. The staff were helpful wherever we needed their help. Breakfast was decent though not many options but then, it was quite ok!  The front desk staff were also helpful and were amenable to our needs! The rooms were a bit small but then they were ok and kept clean!  Overall a good experience!

title: Cheap n' cheerful!
review: We stayed here for  four nights in the month of  from 21st to 24th October-2015. Very close to the station. Room was ok size. Bathroom was clean and with good fittings.  Buffet breakfast was good. Best part of it it was close to many city attractions and restaurants. Walking distance. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Very comfortable stay. Centrally located. Free wi-fi was available in the room.I we would recommend this hotel to other travellers.

title: That shows you the hotel is a liar.
review: I stayed here for 2 nights with my brother while on a train tour of Italy. We needed a cheap and private place (eg not backpackers) to drop our luggage and sleep which was close to the train station. This hotel ticked all the boxes. We had a basic room that was clean and comfortable, the staff were lovely and we were a short walk to the duomo, accademia, and uffizi gallery. No complaints from us!

title: Oh for a good nights sleep
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Adequate
review: We stayed for 10 nights , 1 night in Room 108 , 9 in Room 495 . First room had air conditioning that smelt rather badly , but the staff changed our room on our request. Room 495 was better in that we didn't use the air-con , however the window that provided the only fresh air had to be kept closed , curtains too , as the workers on the scaffolding right outside were banging , scraping , smoking ,talking & anything else that builders do from 8am till finish. Not at night though . At night the building fans took over and you couldn't get a decent night sleep for their noise. San Giorgi e Olimpic does not have a bar , which is disappointing as a cuppa , or a beer would be nice after site seeing trips . Going to the room is hardly a good alternative . Well located for trips into…

title: Honeymoon visit
review: Pros: This hotel is centrally located, a short walk from the train station and the main sights of Florence. The staff are friendly and helpful.   Cons: My single room was so tiny that I could hardly fit my suitcase. It was very shabby,  with an old, stained bedspread, and was generally not up to the standard of cleanliness that I would have liked.  Conclusion: I stayed at the San Georgio hotel for 2 nights and was very busy for the whole time I was in Florence,  so didn't have a lot of time to hang around the hotel. For this reason, the fantastic location was a winner with me and I just put up with the fact that my accommodation was fairly disgusting! However,  if I was visiting Florence again, or wanting a hotel I felt comfortable spending more time in, or was travelling for a…

title: Adequate
review: We stayed here on the 4th stop on our city tour of Italy. Some might describe the decor as 'quaint' - I think compared to the other hotels we stayed in, it was most definitely the most dated, but the service received from the staff was unrivaled.  We did have a couple of problems with the room, but we lived with them - I'm sure if we had reported them to the staff it would have been resolved quickly. The light-bulb in our room blew while we were getting ready for bed (thankfully there were lamps around the room which we could rely on!). The bathroom was adequate, but did not have a shelf or anything to put your shampoo or soap on. The air-conditioning was a little temperamental although worked most of the time.  The most disappointing thing about this hotel was the lack of…

title: 3star with 4star service
review: Some might call this place quaint. Our room and facilities were adequate, though there was no soap dish or place to put your shampoo in the shower bay. The door to the bathroom badly needed oiling. The air conditioning was good. There was less provided for breakfast than at other hotels we have stayed at. I'm not fussy, but my brioche (Italian type of sweet croissant) didn't taste fresh. The lady serving us was efficient but a smile would have helped.

title: Family Vacation Stopover
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Fine for a short stay
review: Stayed here for two nights with family and it was a fine hotel. Decent breakfast. Close to train station, all sights, and shops. Had a great room with balcony view of courtyard. AC worked fine which was good in 90+ degree heat. Staff was helpful booking us a reservation for the Academia which you need to do in advance (oops).

title: Not that great. Just ok to get by.
review: We had a large, comfortable room but the rooms are a bit tired. AC worked fine.  Staff very helpful.  WiFi only really works in foyer.  Very convenient to railway station.  Good breakfast but it seems to take them ages to clear the tables.  You get what you pay for and we enjoyed our stay.

title: Shocking
review: The hotel stuff were friendly and its close to alot of things like market n trains n laundry n supermarket.  But the room is very old style and the "free wifi" dorsnt even work from the room on the 4th floor have to sit next to the elevator stairs to get a solid connection.  And the breakfast was very light food nothing amazing about it.

title: Old style hotel, great location.
review: i didn't enjoy my 2 nights in this hotel. It is certainly convenient to the train station and markets, but honestly there is A lift that takes 2 persons and 2 suitcases, that's it and takes for ever. The breakfast is passable but there is NO smile with the service. The reception is no better.  My room was so small, as was the bathroom but to give credit it would be ideal As 'backpacker' accommodation.  I won't be returning.

title: Perfectly situated for exploring
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: AMAZING HOTEL.
review: We stayed here as part of a tour of Italy, we reached Florence by train and the hotel was in a perfect position. We were close to the market which was well worth a visit and 5 minutes from the main attractions Florence has to offer. We found this especially useful as it was so hot when we visited we needed to return to the hotel for a break from the heat. Lovely restaurants and bars nearby.  We didn't stay for breakfast as we couldn't find a table.

title: Good stay
review: This hotel was incredible! It is close to everything in Florence. The rooms are spacious and nice. The breakfast is very very good. And most importantly the people that work there are really really nice! We have traveled all over the world as a family and this is the best service we have ever gotten. Thank You hotel San Giorgio. You really made our trip to Florence memorable.

title: Fab staff, great location, good breakfast, basic accomodation.
review: We only stayed in Florence for one night, and we didn't particularly need any longer, but this hotel was enough for a short stay, it was just very basic, but if you are after cheaper accommodation this'll do. Very close to train station, we could walk with very heavy luggage, and close to some restaurants and shops. Staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was basic (no hot options) but it was still good.

title: Very Good Location
review: Stayed three nights here following three nights in Venice and travelling to Florence by train. The hotel was close to the train station, the reception staff were really friendly and gave us a good welcome. They were also really helpful booking us excursions and giving us directions - particularly Oliver. The room was quite basic, but air conditioned and clean, comfortable beds. No safe in the room - for passports, extra euros, travel cards etc. We, personally, found Florence too busy and enjoyed our trips out - in particulerly the San Gimignano & Siena with the wine tasting and lunch.

title: Great location but tired hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good location and reasonably priced
review: Fantastic location in the city but this hotel is very tired and in need of refurbishment. The staff were very helpful but the room we were offered was like a monastic cell and the continental breakfast had a very poor choice. Nothing appears to have changed for years.

title: Near train station, sightseeing, duomo, restaurants and everything!
review: We stayed for 5 nights for about EUR445 (excl city tax) including daily breakfast.  The hotel is about 5mins walk from the train station and Central Market so great when you have heavy luggage, plus it has a lift.  Reception staff were very friendly - we had a day tour that departed early one morning and a breakfast bag was organised.  Given the summer heat, the rooms were nice and cool, spacious enough to spread our your things.  We were on the 3/F but alas no wifi, it only worked downstairs on G/F.  Breakfast is very basic and opens from 7:30am which is kind of late.  We were leaving on an 8am train and was downstairs by 7:15am but they were strict with the opening time so suggest during peak season, they consider starting breakfast at 7am.

title: So convenient for St. Marks, The Opera and the Alilaguna
review: I only stayed two nights at this hotel and it was a good short stay, the reception staff were really nice and helpful when I asked them for some directions and where to buy bus tickets. The hotel infrastructure is old, but the rooms (at least the one I got), bath (big bathroom) and common areas were super clean and kind of cozy. Breakfast was continental, nothing to complain about.  I totally recommend this hotel if you want to stay near the train station (maybe 5-7 min. walking from the station to the hotel) and if you want to discover the city on foot.

title: Horrible hotel. The worst I have ever been.
review: Fantastic position at a reasonable price. Clean and comfortable room and very helpful desk staff. Perfect for a visit to the St Marco district. Excellent breakfast for vegetarians, too. We would like to go back but next time we will "do" a different district.

title: Perfect location !
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good Location. Friendly Staff
review: We stayed here for 5 nights in June , the location is ABSOLUTELY ideal! Literally in the centre of the city ! Surrounded by shops, restaurants , the historic sites and a 3 minute walk from the train station. Can only get wifi on the ground floor of the Hotel , but wasnt a problem for us. The breakfast was well presented , lots of choice...croissants, yoghurt's, fruit etc  (but no hot food)  the staff were friendly and helpful and we found the overall stay very pleasant . The rooms could have done with a lick of paint and new bathroom tiles though !

title: Well located and friendly hotel
review: Stayed here for 3 nights.  The room was adequate for our needs, although a little dark.  Nice big bathroom though.  Breakfast was good. Plenty to choose from for a 3 star hotel.  Staff very friendly.  Perfect for our needs.

title: Tired hotel
review: We had a great experience here.  The hotel is just a few minutes from the main railway station and within easy walking distance of all the main attractions in Firenze.  We were particularly impressed with the young man on the reception desk (it's some time ago now and I don't recall his name).  He helped us considerably with advice an timetables on trains and in booking a tour.

title: Comfortable stay
review: we stayed in this hotel on our second leg of our tour of Italy, it's convenient as its a five minute walk from the train station, but Iam afraid that's were the good news ends. The room we stayed in had two single beds, there was a window that overlooked a very small courtyard from which cooking smells drifted, the bathroom was very small and in a poor condition, and. It very clean and to be honest it was just past its best. The whole room could have done with a deep clean form the carpeted (yes carpets not tiles) floor to the tops of the wardrobe which was caked in dust. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis but only had the breakfast on the first day as there was little choice, for example there was an orange juice machine that did not produce orange juice and boiled eggs…

title: Convenient
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: 3 day city break
review: The staff was very helpful and nice when it came to getting around.  Walking distance from the train station, which was very convenient.  Museums and Cathedrals were just a short walk away.  The only downfall was it only had wifi, in the main lounge area.  The rooms looked  just like the pictures, and were clean.  It was overall a nice hotel for the 2 days I stayed.

title: City honeymoon
review: Just returned from a 3 night 4 day break  - disappointing hotel - room with no natural light and dismal bathroom that needed renovating.  That said, it was in a great location and was clean .  Florence is about the sights so if you're not too bothered about accommodation it will do!

title: Basic but good
review: Lovely room with balcony and a complimentary bottle of fizz for our honeymoon. However very limited breakfast. Very close to train station and historic centre, but due to this a very noisy location all night!

title: Friendly and comfortable
review: Basic hotel in the San Lorenzo area, in the city center, Very well located! Basic but good value for money. Pedestrian area. Close to everything and very good restaurants nearby. The covered Market is a must see. Near Santa Maria Novella train station.

title: Great hotel & very close to Station
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: was a really nice place
review: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel because of its great location; walking distance to Firenze SMN station & main sights of Florence. Reasonably priced with 24-hr front desk. Clean room with basic bathroom amenities (only had a small bar of soap, shower cap). The only bad thing was that the wifi in our room wouldn't connecting so we had to go downstairs to the lobby to use the Internet.

title: Good staff
review: very good quality especially for the price right around the corner from the main florence train station and fairly close to all the other main sites in florence  staff were friendly and helped me with my bags and escorted me to my room  breakfast was decent, a standard continental breakfast and free unlimited wifi

title: Wonderful Christmas
review: I liked this hotel. Location is the best about the hotel. Our(standard) room was cozy and quiet. Staffs were nice and always keen to help. Sleepers are given and breakfast was fine. There was no fruit served, though.

title: Very old hotel, excellent location
review: Old building but nice place inside. Clean rooms with service every day. Satisfied WIFI. Good breakfast. Near the train station Santa Maria Novella.  The staff  are polite and helpful. Value for money hotel. I certainly prefer it again

title: Good hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Lovely hotel close to everything
review: Great central location, close to city attractions and transport networks. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable but was in need of maintenance.  The wifi did not work well, we had to sit out in a particular spot in the hallway for it to work adequately. Probably still good value for money.

title: Good for the money
review: Arriving by train we found it in about 10 minutes. Good size room, excellent bathroom comfortable Queen size bed.  Staff very helpful advising of good restaurants near by and other attractions.Luckily we talked to them as we were not aware many museums did not open on Mondays. So late Sunday we managed to get in to see the statue of David.  Breakfast fine for our needs. Wifi a bit of a problem in room but fine in foyer lounge.  Thoroughly enjoyed our stay as everything was within close walking distance.  Our room on 2 floor was a bit noisy early in the morning due to street sweepers and garbage collection.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Good Location
review: I stayed in that hotel for one night during November. The location is perfect close to the train station (SMN) and the city center, also many restaurants and small bars are around. Hotel was clean, only the carpets could be changed since you could see some stains, but what is the most important for me you didn't fell the smell of cigarets in the room that I really heat. The breakfast was also quite nice, some bared, cheese, ham and sweet staff like croissant and cakes. Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Good location
review: I based this hotel on its location to the train station.  Room was of large size as well as the bathroom.  I was in the back of the building so WiFi not as strong, had to go down to lobby for stronger and steady connection.  Enjoyed breakfast daily.  Laundry/Dry Cleaning available at a cost or do it yourself just down the street.  Only issue was the condemned hotel across from the hotel, seemed to be the main urinal for people, very pungent smell when coming from passing by it in route to the hotel entrance. Stayed 2 nights, 8 - 10 Oct.

title: Good experience
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good location
review: Big room with Big bathroom, great location very near to train station,  close to 3 churches one of which was the beautiful Duomo, nearby have many great famous restaurant,  many socket on wall for me to charge electronic gadget, strong wifi at reception, only down side was No wifi on 5th floor..

title: Perfect Stay
review: We recently stayed 2 nights at this hotel and whilst its location is very good for the railway station and only a few minutes walk from the centre of the city and whilst the staff were very polite, very helpful, sadly the room was in need of redecoration.

title: A week in Florence
review: This hotel is family run, and a traditional Italian hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful with our stay in Florence! Breakfast was perfect for the start to the day (cold meats, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juice, and crossiants). Air conditioned and not paper thin walls! The hotel was right across the street from the train station (do not taxi it there, its not even a five mint walk!). We were able to walk eveywhere we needed to see while at this hotel, great location, not to mention the all day tours for Tuscany leave at the train station so we woke up, did not rush, and walked to our bus! The place was clean and beds were actually very comfortable!

title: Another excellent stay
review: 7 days at the San Giorgio. A pleasant friendly hotel. Staff were very helpful and breakfast more than adequate. Rooms serviced daily with clean towels etc. Air conditioned throughout. Some commented old fashioned but I would describe as traditional. Not a fan of plastic cloned hotels. Near to station and 10 minutes from most of the main sites. Restaurants within a minutes wal. Would certainly stop here again and recommend to friends.

title: Comfortable and conveniently located
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: allways a good choice
review: The hotel is conveniently located very near Florence main station and city centre. Breakfast is good. Although the rooms are a bit outdated, for a short stay one can do with. Rooms are clean. Ideal for a short stay

title: excellent location but..
review: We have stayed here a few times .. most recently we took the morning  Eurostar from Rome for three days two nights in Florence  and this was a perfect location ..our room had a  nice view of the roof tops , Staff was very friendly and one remembered me from a visit two years ago .. they gave us a late check out on the third day as we were taking the Late Train back to Rome .. The Breakfast is always a treat here and we lingered talking to other guest .. We love to visit Florence and have stayed in 5-6 hotels this one we recommend

title: Excellent location !
review: the hotel has an excellent location, only 2-3 minutes walking from the train station and from the main monuments of the city. Unfortunately rooms are not so comfortable and too much old. The price is a bit high if compared to the offer. No complaints for the rich breakfast buffet. Hotel very clean! In general, I can reccomend this hotel to spend few days in Flrence to enjoy the city by day and by night!

title: reasonable and convenient
review: Very convenient location - a short walk from the Santa Maria Novella Station. Very central, and quite close to all modes of transport to move around. The rooms are a bit old, but fairly spacious. En suite toilets are clean. Free wifi. Average breakfast (not too much choice). We stayed 3 nights, and found it a perfect value for money. In a very nice street, full of activity. The beauty of Florence is that you can walk around very conveniently, and this hotel is ideal if you want to stay in a "happening" part of town. There are quite a few good restaurants just walking distance from the hotel. The staff was very helpful and spoke perfect English. Excellent choice - will return again for sure.

title: Excellent location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Five in Florence
review: Situated minutes from SMN station the San Giorgio has excellent location especially as the walking tour we were booked on shortly after arrival was also minutes from hotel.  Staff were prepared to assist with any questions we may have and even printed off train timetables for us which was very beneficial as SMN is very busy and quite confusing.  Breakfast was average but again staff were on hand to ensure we had everything we needed.  Rooms were basic, but very clean and adequately furnished.  Would definitely book again.

title: budget - good location
review: We enjoyed our stay at the San Giorgio.  Location was very close to the train station but as you turned the corner to the hotel you entered a classic narrow Florence street, with nice restaurants and a coin-laundry just steps away.  Just up the street is a busy open market, which my teenage girls enjoyed walking through each day on the way to the sights that are quite close by.  The staff is reserved but warm.  This older, smaller hotel is very charming and comfortable, with a good breakfast and coffee. The wifi only really works in the lobby, which has a cozy sitting area with a couple couchs and several chairs for hanging out. We would love to stay here again.

title: Most satisfying stay!
review: This hotel is very good located. Walking distance to train station and bus stop and numerous attractions. Go for a walk up and down the narrow streets. Not too much noise. Bathroom needs updating. Value for money.

title: Traditional firenze hotel
review: Loved it for the location- enough said- it was perfect! Literal 5 minutes from station then 5 minutes to centre of Firenze.  Offers breakfast which is good enough! The entrance is old style but very comfortable. The whole hotel had a cosy, at home feeling. Reception was friendly and welcoming, though we waited a bit for our room to be prepared at 2pm.   The room was spacious enough for three people and air con was really nice for summer.

title: Hotel did the job
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Location good rest average
review: Pros: location near tourist sights and train station if planning to ride rails often with florence as home base. Our room was surprisingly a good size, don't know if that's same for all. Breakfast coffee was good. Cons: Bathroom was small and toilet flushing was a challenge. Dragging bags around step filled 5th floor was fun. Getting coffee during breakfast was a mission. Would book again for right price because really only used hotel to sleep.

title: Very good location, nice 3 star hotel
review: San Giorgio is 3-4 minutes walk from SMN railway station and is easy to locate.  Room allotted to us on fifth floor was well sized with little terrace. But little worn out in terms of furniture and maintenance. The wardrobe was old. and did not closed properly. The Air-conditioner stopped working in the middle of night. (Not only in our room but also in neighboring room) The steel chairs in terrace were old and with damaged hand rest, etc. However, room and bathroom were clean. Bathroom is very small with tiny shower cubicle and the exhaust fan in my bathroom was not working. You can hear noise from adjacent rooms so privacy is limited.  Out side the rooms we had nice little semi open lounge but sofa springs had given away making you sink in it when you seat.  Breakfast is…

title: Excellent Florence Hotel
review: We visited Florence and we were recommended to stay at the San Giorgio Hotel. We stayed 3 nights, in a large room with all expected amenities. Received great service from the staff enjoy d the location and the access to so many restaurants. If you want a medium hotel in a central location, this hotel is highly recommended.

title: Fantastic three day break
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Like Italy, maybe a bit tired but a great place to be.
review: The hotel room was very comfortable with a nice big bathroom.
