Very friendly and helpful staff at the reception.Could not have been better positioned for all the sites and the train station, great for travel out to surrounding areas and/or the airport at Pisa. Breakfast was continental and adequate until you find somewhere for a leisurely lunch ( definitely no shortage of places for that. All in all a great base for seeing this incredible city.

title: Our Holiday
review: Typical Italian hotel I thought. The location Is fantastic.The staff were very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was plentiful. If you want a boring, sterile souless hotel go stay in one. If you want a sense of Italy and are on a budget, try this.

title: old hotel
review: We stayed at San Giorgio for 5 nights.It is our second visit here.Very friendly staff good location for gettin about.Nice continental breakfast in the morning.Clean and comfortable rooms all u need for your stay in Firenze.

title: Clean but needs Updating
review: Best thing about this hotel is location, 7min. from main train station, 10min. from the centre and 2min from the place from where you to take buses for local tour. Very old building, small lift and so many stairs on every floor. lobby is nice with Wi-Fi,  breakfast was ok.

title: Good located hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: very low Budget stay
review: Right next to the main railway station, you can literally  pull your luggage from the station to the hotel. The tour buses to the Tuscan countryside also start from just outside the hotel. The Duomo is also a few minutes walking distance. The Santa Maria Novella church is opposite the hotel. The hotel is clean but slightly old. The room size was quite big for a three star.

title: if getting a good price comparatively, book it.
review: Run down hotel, we stayed with our teens and were all in one room with a fold out bed, the bathroom was dirty and the bedding (blankets) were about as old as the hotel, the breakfasts were poor , and our room was very noisy hearing all the pedestrians outside (we were on the 2nd flr) recommend for young travellers only not families.

title: Convenient
review: Stayed for 2 nights. Hotel is at an ideal location, nice hotel in a category, the staff was very nice and helpful, gave us few good suggestions what to see, where to go and when. The room itself was very big, very outdated interior but, that’s the case we saw with most of the 3* hotels in Italy we have stayed. All in all if you are getting a good price comparatively, book it.

title: Budget Florence
review: The hotel at a walking distance to the train station, the Duomo, San Lorenzo, Vechhico Palace, River Arno… etc. Has a large number of rooms and lobbies in each floor. There’s no exceptional view per se but you can see how close the main attractions are from the top floors. Food is fine. However, there is only 1 lift. The staff is friendly. You can find a large number of restaurants around.

title: Needs a lot of renovations
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good location but jaded hotel
review: The only positive point about this hotel is its location because it is located near Florence main train station as well as some historic and famous buildings. The furniture is outdated but tolerable. The most seriously negative point is that because of old installations and equipment you will probably face terrible problems. We stayed there for two nights and at the first day we could not use warm water to take shower because the installation was out of order and it was really a disaster. Unfortunately the staff just said that "It is not our fault!"

title: Nice but old hotel
review: The best thing about the San Giorgio is its location near Florence's main train station, Santa Maria Novella. Our room had mature furniture in the Tuscan rustic style which is not to my taste. Our room overlooked a small unused courtyard but this made it very quiet at night. The bathroom was small with poor fittings, particularly the shower with no dish to put the soap and shampoo in. No English language TV. Breakfast was OK but no fresh fruit, tough rolls and vanilla flavoured croissant. Perhaps a Tuscany speciality but not too my taste. Tables weren't cleared and they have an odd policy with knives.  They leave spoons and forks for you to collect but you have to wait for the waiter to bring coffee and your knives.  Perhaps its Health & Safety getting in on the act. Short walk…

title: San Giorgio, a fine family hotel
review: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The staff was excellent. Breakfast was pretty good. The room had very old furniture but the bathroom and beds were very good. If I go back to Florence I will certainly go back to this hotel.

title: Most Convenient Location
review: Stayed at the San Giorgio 2 nights in September.  It is a fine family-owned hotel with excellent friendly/helpful staff.  The complimentary breakfast was very nice.  We arrove in Firenze via Trenitalia and the location of the hotel was an easy walk with luggage.  Our room was very adequate [typical remodeled/updated older Italian building].  Most all the major sites are within an easy walking distance [Michelangelo's "David" & other terrific museum items, Baptistery/Duomo/Campanile Tower, Museum with Ghiberti's golden doors, Piazza della Signoria with it's great sculptures, Ponte Vecchio bridge; even the Michelangelo Piazza across the river is really not too far].  Very pleased with the hotel.

title: Great place to stay!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great location
review: The San Giorgio is a great place to stay in Florence. It is ideally located near the SMN train station  and had several lovely restaurants nearby. Though the hotel is old, and the rooms are small, the service they provide is invaluable! Wonderful front desk staff who go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The breakfast provided is simple, but adequate. Location is ideal as we were able to walk to most of the city attractions without difficulty. You have to remember that it is a 3 star hotel. I would recommend it to anyone who wants plain basic service and an enjoyable experience.

title: centre of it all
review: Solo traveller so had small single room which was fine and all i needed. Location is near train station and Piazza San Lorenzo. Breakfast was pretty good and staff front desk staff happy to help. Free wifi in lobby, doesnt work well in rooms. Would stay here again.

title: Good location. Great staff. Lovely room. Delicious breakfast.
review: its a good basic hotel - clean friendly - parking right there laundry - walking to all attractions - breakfast is good - would stay there again - easy check in - wifi only in the front area - was there 3 nights - price was very good for the location etc..

title: Old fashioned but OK
review: We had trouble finding the hotel after our arrival by train from Rome. But once we found it we were thrilled. The common room, lobby, upon your entrance, was welcoming and cosy with free wifi. The counter staff were helpful and friendly. We were on the first floor (2nd floor for Americans) with our room having one window which opened into an inner courtyard. Florence had been very hot but our room was comfortable with excellent air con. The room was fabulous with a large bed, huge wardrobe, plenty of drawer space and an excellent en-suite. The breakfast was delicious with good quality  fresh foods. A nice selection of breads, yogurts and fruit. Some meat and cheese as well. Juices were fine. Coffee good.

title: fabulous hotel in the very heart of the city
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good location
review: this hotel was great value for money in the very heart of Florence - rooms are basic with AC and a mini bar - fresh towels every day and breakfast was plentiful for continental. Also free wifi would book again in a second-fabulous

title: Great Location
review: A very good location near to the train station and to the key attractions in Florence. The room was fairly clean but spacious, there was a poor selection of television programmes. The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly.

title: This is a haven in Florence
review: Less than five minute walk from train station.  Within walking distance to the major Florence attractions.  Hotel shows its age but rooms are clean.  Reception staff friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is the typical continental breakfast expected for a hotel at that price range.  Great variety of restaurants and grocery stores just outside your door steps.

title: Perfect location. Could be cleaner.
review: We had an unplanned stop in Florence (due to illness) and were lucky enough to get a room in the San Giorgio, which is very near the central station.   The room was big, airy (with A/C), quiet and very clean, and so was the bathroom.   However the crowning glory, for us, was the attitude and caring approach of the staff, who could not have been more helpful.  The hotel is excellent value for money, and we're looking forward to returning soon for a longer, planned stay in Florence.

title: No more please!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: great location
review: This was the worst stay in Italy. 1) Only one good point - location, 5 mins walk. 2) Located next to an empty block, you will have a strange smell before entering the hotel every time.  3) This hotel design is like 80's, renovation is needed, The room, bed, bathroom were like using for years... I feel itchy during my stay... 4) The world heaviest hotel room key was returned to the reception everytime before you're leaving the hotel, however, no identification checking is required, just tell your room number.  Good luck to your belongings in the room. 5) Auto alarm 5:45am - by auto turning off the air condition due to drop of temperature, you will feel hot in the room and wake up. 6) However, breakfast starts 7:30am (noone would mention to you until you came down at 7am for…

title: The best located hotel in Florence and best service
review: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel. The location is terrific. It is close to the train station and to shops, bars and restaurants. The hotel is not incredibly luxurious but the rooms are clean and comfortable. It is also quiet. It is also close to bus stops. The staff here have always been very helpful. The breakfast is excellent value for money and provides a variety of foods. It is close to many historical sites and to the wonderful, bustling maket.

title: Centrally located hotel
review: We stayed for the bank holiday The staff were so helpful polite and accommodating fantastic breakfast rooms were very clean and quiet and the hotel was so central we could walk everywhere This is where y need to stay if u want to go to florence

title: Wonderful time at the San Giorgio Florence
review: This hotel is easy to find, close to center Firenze, but it is worn out hotel, needs renovation. I was there in april 2013 with my wife, we enjoyed the trip, we were a little disappointed with the quality of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, like in other hotels around the World. But for the Price of the rooms and what we got, that didn't add up. The breakfast was ok, it wasn't rich, but edible. Many room turn towards the street and it is so noisy until 11:30pm every day, that is a huge minus. If you want an central placed hotel, with 5 minutes walk to the dome and shopping streets, then this is the place.

title: Quiet but close to the transport hubs
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great location, friendly and helpful staff
review: We stayed for 3 nights and found the staff extremely polite and helpful. The hotel is wonderfully situated for all the main sights and the central market. We had a room on the 5th floor and walked through the upstairs Sitting Room to get there. The view of the Duomo from there is great.

title: Perfect 2 star hotel for exploring Florence
review: Stayed here for four nights before heading off to Pisa. Very friendly and helpful staff who gave us lots of information about things to do and we could also purchase tickets for various excursions from the desk which we took full advantage of. Rooms were clean, slightly run down and old fashioned but clean non the less. Very small bathroom though and found myself twisting around a lot in the shower and I'm an average sized woman so would have been interested in seeing how a 6'2 man would of coped! Non the less it was clean.   Nice little view overlooking the square and could just see the top of the dome in the distance. No tea or coffee making facilities which was disappointing. Very very quiet at night time except for the occasional flushing of toilets from next door (walls…

title: Amazing staff
review: We've stayed here before and didn't hesitate to stay again for three nights. It is a perfectly adequate hotel at the price. Staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean, functional, en suite and fairly standard buffet breakfast. Perfectly placed in walking distance of the station and for exploring old Florence on foot. Had a TV which was a bit unnnecessary because you dont go here to stay in your room. Dont expect a view other than whats outside. Could have done with a kettle and tea coffee makings. Rooms are no smoking but corridor stank of smoke.Recommended as a budget hotel.

title: Good Value For Money
review: FIRST. DO NOT CARRY ALL YOUR MONEY WITH YOU IN A BACK PACK. CARRY IT BACK TO FRONT. I.E. YOUR BACK PACK ON YOUR FRONT. BE WARNED. LOST ALL HOLIDAY MONEY.WHAT AN IDIOT. Pick pockets rife In Florence. Hotel staff amazing. Contacted my holiday company citallia. Rep contacted me within two minutes Given lots of help to sort out cash loss. Obtained replacement cash within 12 hours  Hotel right in the centre of Florence 10 minute walk from station. Room not huge but adequate spotless linen and towels excellent beds very clean.room and  shower room very clean. Could do with updating but you only sleep there. Felt safe and very comfortable for a single senior citizen travelling who aught to have known better. Would have given five star if had been more up to date.

title: Friendly, but shabby
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Shabby not chic, but a very friendly hotel
review: This hotel was far below our expectations. While the staff was very friendly and helpful (hence 2 stars instead of 1), the room was horrible. The best I can say is that it was clean. We had no hot water in the morning, the bed was hard as a rock, and the walls were so thin we could hear everything going on around us all night long. Worst night of sleep on our trip; thankfully we only stayed 1 night. In addition, there were problems with the toilet not flushing correctly (took about 10 tries before it worked). Breakfast was ok, but very crowded and tightly packed, which would have been ok if the staff kept food and plates stocked, but they didn't.   The hotel was on the level of a Motel 6. Would not recommend to anyone.

title: Value for money, safe, homely base in Florence
review: The staff here are very friendly and its location is great.  Good places to eat nearby including a vegetarian restaurant called IL Vegetariano (10 min walk) and small friendly place a few doors away called La Padellaccia. At the hotel the breakfast was plentiful, although no fresh fruit. Coffee comes from the kitchen in a jug and is far from perfect!! If you prefer tea with boiling water and a teapot - forget it! Good sized room but not as nice as its photo on their website. Comfy, clean bed. However the carpet in our room was not clean before we arrived but it was hoovered the next day. The wall paper was grubby and coming off the walls in places and one of the sliding wardrobe door handles was missing. People in the next room were smokers and the smell came through the wall…

title: A true taste of italian hospitality
review: Stayed here with a friend from 24th to 27th March. Informed the hotel that we would be arriving late at night and immediately received a reply from Filippo (at 3 am!) confirming our late check-in.   Upon arrival, we were checked in quickly. The staff is very approachable and efficient. Their lady cook made fresh delicious bread every morning and also served us coffee. Breakfast options were sparse (bread, one type of ham, cheese, cereals), but is enough to get you through half a day if included in your room package. If not, there are lots of options a few doors down from the hotel entrance.  The hotel's location is awesome; it only takes about a 5 minute walk (less if you walk faster or have longer legs) to reach the Firenze Santa Maria Novella Station, and there are subways…

title: Nice hotel in great location
review: Hotel San Giorgio was the highlight of our three days in Florence. My wife got sick and i was impressed by how the entire staff and the owners Cristina and Chiara helped us though doctors and pharmacies. The hotel is so charming full of welcoming vibe and clean. The location couldn't be better with all the historical center within walking distances. We'd definitely recommend hotel San Giorgio  for a pleasant and enjoyable sojourn in belllissima Firenze.

title: Great Hotel in Florence
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Old but,service is not but
review: We stayed here for three nights in January 2013. The room and bathroom were clean. The room was small was fine. The beds were very comfortable and there was free wi-fi in the rooms. The breakfast was very good and the staff was extremely  helpful. The location was convenient to everything. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Cheap hotel with an amazing location
review: Station is 5 min by foot. It is good. But, water of shower is so poor. It takes 20min to put water bus tab full. The room is not bad, it cost about €65 per doubul Bed room.  駅からはとての近いですが、バスタブに水を溜めるのに20分ほどかかり、シャワーの水の出も悪いです。お値段は安くてサービスも良いです。

title: Beautiful Florence
review: This hotel is the standard 3-stars hotel in a big city. Clean, simple and cheap. I had already a similar experience in Florence. San Giorgio is 2 minutes far from the Train Station and 5 minutes far from the Dome of Florence. It's perfect to enjoy the center of this amazing city, especially if you're going to spend your time walking and visiting art gallery and museums. Not far from there, there is even the district of the Market (Borgo San Lorenzo), where we've found many good restaurant. So the location is perfect. The hotel is clean but a little old-fashioned, they should think about some renovations (cracks in the walls, old furniture). I dont want to give "4 stars" because we had several problems with the lock of our door, immagine to back from a looong day and to fight…

title: Perfect Location
review: We were in Florence 6 -11 October 2012. This is not our first trip. Each time choosing a hotel we stay at San Giorgio. Lovely staff, good breakfast, clean rooms. 10 minutes from the center, 3 minutes to the train station. Perfect location for those who like to travel to Italy!

title: just the job
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great location, very helpful staff!
review: two minutes from the rail station, perfect for those who fly to pisa and then transfer to florence by rail. clean, friendly, helpful and close by everything you would want to see in this city on a mini break. we were very fond of the old fashioned reception area, it even has a post box for posting cards and a little telephone kiosk, best of all there's always someone around to help you. breakfast a bit basic, but the indoor market is just two minutes away and there's a choice of anything you might like to eat at good prices. we came here in july 2011.

title: Super Central VS Super Old
review: We stayed at the San Giorgio for four nights in late October, the location was fantastic.  Lucca, at the front desk, spoke very good English and was tremendously helpful.  Our room was small, clean and quaint; we were only there to sleep so we didn't require much more.    The breakfasts each morning were simple but plentiful.  We had a small problem with the shower and reported it when we left in the morning, when we arrived back that night the problem had been resolved.  We couldn't believe the location - it was the best; close to the train station, all points of interest, shops, museums, great restaurants, the Duomo and the starting point for many of our tours.    We would highly recommend this hotel for it's wonderful staff and location!

title: Near train station, central location
review: We were surprised by the location. Three minutes walk from the train station and a few blocks from Duomo, museums, restaurants and shops. Now, the cons. When we check in, the receptionist was very moody, looked like a psyco-killer or a creepy butler. Staff not friendly at all. I was afraid to ask him later how to turn the old shower on (which, by the way, smells like gas!!). Our room was comfortable and clean, but it's all pretty old. On one day during our stay, just the light of the buiding ended. I think they need a makeover. But in Italy it seems that the older, more pride they have in their facilities ...

title: Nice location helpful staff
review: The hotel was close to the train station and easy to find. Staff was nice and their breakfast was great. But our room was old, dark and smelled bad we had to have the window open the entire time. Next time I visit Florence I would choose another hotel.

title: Good location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great Location
review: We received a warm welcome upon arrival and the staff were most personable. The hotel is in a good location for train travellers and close to major attractions. The biggest problem we had was the AC ventilation appeared to circulate cigarette smoke from another room. Not good for a friend with sensitive allergies. Breakfast was basic but enough to get us started for the day.

title: Location good but hotel is not great
review: The hotel is very close to the train station.  The front desk personnel were very friendly.  Luca spoke English and was very helpful in telling us about tours and restaurants.  The rooms are small but we were only there to sleep and the bed was great.  There was a minibar and a safe in our room.  Although the bathroom was not very large, it was adequate.  I would stay there again.

title: Good Basic Hotel in Florence
review: The location of this hotel was very close to train station. However, it lacks a lot in other areas. The rooms are very small and bathrooms were cramped. If it cooled off below 80* at night,they would turn off air conditioning. This would be ok if they had windows that opened properly. They had no window screens and good air flow was very bad. The staff was polite and rooms were clean but very old and out dated for the price we paid. This hotel needs to be update very badly. We complained about the size of our room and was moved to a larger room within 3 days of our 7 day stay. It was larger but no better in style or bathroom size. LBD50

title: OK & Good location
review: We stayed at Hotel San Giorgio in a twin room on bed and breakfast basis. The room was a reasonable size. The twin beds had good mattresses and there were some nice antique pieces of furniture. Room was clean although carpet showed signs of wear. There was a minibar but no safe. There was air conditioning but we didn't use it as not needed.  The bathroom was a good size with hairdryer, sink, bidet, toilet, shower. We had a small sit in bath which was really appreciated at the end of a long day walking.  The hotel is nice, in a good location (5 min from station) and has free wifi. The staff are helpful, providing extra pillows on request. The breakfast is fine.  The only issue was some building noise between 10am-6pm but as we were mainly out it was not a problem.

title: Very tired looking hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Brilliant
review: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our room was very dark and dingy, with a cramped bathroom. We had a view of the back of the hotel which wasn't great! The lift was minute, and the corridor walls were very tatty and a yucky brownish colour which really didn't go well with the green carpet. The whole place could just do with redecorating to give it a lift. The breakfast room was a vile yellow, and breakfast itself wasn't as good as it could have been. The wifi wasn't anything to shout about either - very sporadic. The website also states that hairdryers are provided - we had to ask for one, and received the tiniest hairdryer I have ever seen in my life! The staff weren't exactly overfriendly either. All in all, a place to sleep - not exactly horrendous, but just disappointing really.

title: Worst hotel ever
review: We are very sorry about your staing in our hotel....but as you saw everywhere ,we are restrutioning to fix for fire dept. You did not tell us nothing,and we check wifi in all the building  : it is ok... best regards

title: Very bad...
review: Four of us stayed for 8 nights.03/09/12 to 11/09/12. The rooms were clean & comfortable and I I cannot understand the comments made by PP & alexanderD71, the only thing they got right was the great position of the hotel. Trains & buses nearby & the main sights within walking distance. Our rooms were cleaned very well each day. The breakfast was very good including the service from the breakfast lady! The great plus for this hotel however was the excellent help we received from reception. A special mention to Luca & Oliver who made are holiday a success by helping us organise our sightseeing days. Well done San Giorgio Hotel I would love to come again!!  Peter F.

title: Another super stay
review: I spent 3 nights in this nightmare. Only good thing about this hotel is its location. Anything else is substandard. Dirty wallpapers and rooms, mouldy bathroom, disgusting shower head and the free wifi doesn't work. Not even in the lounge. Someone mentioned the dinner lady who serves the breakfast. Yes she does mumble all the time and not nice at all.

title: Good.
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: An Old-World Hotel in a Great Location
review: Good value for money.  Excellent location. Three mins walk from the train station.  Comfortable bed. Toilet was clean. Breakfast was good- croissant, tea, coffee, juice, yogurt, cheese, prunes, peaches, and etc.  Free wifi only available in the lounge which can be quite inconvenient.  Free luggage storage after checking out which was very helpful :) Overall quite good :)

title: The smallest bathroom we have had in a hotel.
review: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the San Giorgio.  The room was spacious, the bathroom was large enough--I am tall and had no problem with the location of the toilet next to the shower-- and the armoir was roomy enough for both my clothes and my husband's clothes.  The buffet provided an assortment of goodies--boiled eggs, granola-type cereal, meats and cheese, rolls, croissants, and juices. My husband did enjoy the decaffeinated coffee--some of the best he has ever tasted.    The hotel is in a good location.  It's within walking distance of just about everything one needs to see.  The shopping, though, was really a plus.  There were tons of small restaurants, trattorias, tavola caldas, and cafeterias about.  There is an ATM--Bancomat--right outside of the hotel, and there…

title: I stayed here June 23-25 2012 for my step-daughter's wedding
review: Stayed here as my wife stayed here a few years ago when she was single.Conveniently located, walking distance to most landmarks. On check in, staff were helpful and pleasant. Our room was clean, however had the smallest bathroom we had seen. The problem was the glass shower screen. It opened on the corner meaning you almost had to soap yourself up to get in as the opening was not wide enough and I am not a fat person. My wife scolded herself as she turned around, knocking the mixer tap to full hot. Very easy to do due to the lack of space.This shower screen also meant you could not sit on the toilet as your knees bump in to it. I ended up using the bathroom at the end of the corridor. They need to replace the screen with a curtain and all would be fixed. Breakfast was fine, lots…

title: Very Disappointing!
review: This hotel is conveniently situated very centrally, near the main railway station, but is in a quiet side street. The nearest landmark is the Hotel Baglioni - stand in front of it and look to your left and you will see 2 streets...San Giorgio is at the near end of the left most one. You may even see its projecting sign. It is a very basic hotel, television and phone in room, but no clock or kettle. Air conditioning is just about adequate and not too noisy. Don't expect a view as many of the rooms look onto a little courtyard at the back, but at least you would have no traffic noise. Breakfast is basic, served between 7.30 and 9.30, cereals, whole milk, croissants, hard boiled eggs, ham, flavoured yoghourts, tinned peaches, prunes, tea and coffee etc. I found the front desk very…

title: San Giorgio e Olimpic - Dump!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great value for money and brilliant location
review: Please, please, do not even attempt to stay at this hotel.  It is a complete and utter dump.  My girlfriend and I checked into this hotel in March of 2012 only to find the room to be completely unacceptable!  Stains on the bedspread, stains on the carpet, mold on the tub and shower curtain which was hanging by a metal clothes hanger (no shower just a curtain around a tub with a hand held shower head), water stains on the ceiling from a leaky roof, water stains on the walls and on the pictures on the walls, brown matter on the rug ( I can only guess what this was!). The halls getting to the rooms were so narrow we had to hold our suitcases sideways to get through. The pictures on line look nice but don't be fooled.  This hotel is something out of the 1940's and hasn't been…

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL AND PRICE
review: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel San Giorgio in Florence. This is a spotlessly clean, rather old fashioned and very friendly little hotel perfectly situated for exploring the old city of Florence.  It is located about five minutes walk from the central railway station, perfect if you are flying into /out of Pisa airport. A few minutes walk the other way and we were straight into the historic San Lorenzo district and a brilliant market. The room décor was quite basic and a bit 'tired' but spotless and the room was cleaned and serviced every day while we were out. Breakfasts were the typical continental style you expect in Italy/France/Spain etc with cold meat, cheese, eggs and bread rolls/croissants plus cereals and juice.  There are loads of great little…

title: good for disabled travellers
review: OUR  arrive was very friendly and we were given a map and told where everything was without haveing to ask   WEstayed for 4 nights in room 360 which was very clean and bright bathroom also very clean and bright with lots of hot water and the towels and bedding  was lovely and white and soft . breakfast also good tea coffee jucie rolls jams ham cheese eggs friut help yourself so no need to go hungery . .  there also a nice lounge to wait in and they we look after your cases for you  as for postion of this hotel its mins away from bus and rail stations and near most attractions  ladys beaware you have to walk through the market to get to most things and its full of lovely leather handbags and coats turn left out of hotel and left again and you will come to trattoria da guido …

title: Excellent hotel and price
review: I took my elderly disabled father to Florence and we stayed in this hotel. Most important for me was to get Dad safely around the hotel, his bedroom and bathroom. The disabled room (#107) was on the first floor, serviced by a small lift which was very close to the room. A slight step up to get into the room and then another slight step within the room. All in all it was easy to get my father around in his wheelchair. The bathroom was large and featured an open 'wet room' style shower with seat plus wc with grab bars - very easy to circulate around.  The best aspect about staying here were the staff who were always very helpful to my father and I. For example they always offered to take out a wooden ramp to the front door to help me negotiate the step leading into the hotel  with…

title: Florence- The Rennaissance City
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Second stay at the hotel
review: Very centrally located. Very close to the Railway station and the historic city. All the main historical sights are within walking distance. The pick up point for the city tour and other day trips is very close. The room was clean  but not very spacious. The corridor leading to the room was very narrow and dark. Breakfast is reasonably good .  The staff at the front desk were courteous and helpful. Our stay in the hotel was  comfortable and we enjoyed our visit to Florence.

title: Great Location
review: I first stayed at San Giorgio Hotel in August, 2011 and was impressed by the staff, location and everything. The hotel is very well located and close to everything from the main train station (Santa Maria Novella), Santa Maria Novella Church, San Lorenzo, the Duomo to the Uffizi Galleria. Staff were very helpful and  tried to help us in anyway they could though we did not speak the same language (the ladies at the breakfast room). Overall, it was another lovely stay and I would recommend it to everyone.

title: Great location...noisy at night.
review: We stayed for five nights and found our room comfortable and clean.  The staff were all very helpful and friendly.  The location is great.  Walking distance to the train station and close to all that Florence has to offer........  sights, good eating places.  Basic but good value.

title: No sleep
review: We recently stayed here on our tour through Italy. Front desk staff are helpful and friendly. Elevator moves at the speed of a turtle, and is very small. Breakfast is average at best...get there early or all the tables will be dirty. You are right in the centre of all the attractions...minutes to the duomo and David. Hundreds of restaurants to choose from all within minutes. Our room faced the street and was rather loud at night. We had to keep the windows open as I couldnt figure out the fan/air system. All in all good stay. Hint...(we could have known about this earlier) hand your key into front desk every time you leave! The thing weighs 10 pounds. We found this out on day 3 after lugging it around  everywhere.

title: Great location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good for what it is - wouldn't be my first choice
review: This hotel is in a perfect location, right next to the train and bus station and near to all the attractions in Florence.  Although it was close to all amenities it was very quiet at night.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  However, the bedroom furniture had seen better days and had glass tops had sharp edges so be careful.  The staff were all friendly except for the breakfast maid who was slow at refilling empty baskets and asking if you require tea or coffee.  The breakfast was basic but acceptable.  I would recommend this hotel as it is so well located but only if you are staying a couple of nights.  Florence itself is the most romantic city and there is loads to see and do.

title: Good Hotel
review: I stayed at San Giorgio e Olimpic in Florence for 4 nights.  It is very close to the train station and very conveniently located in general.  It was clean and the staff was very courteous.  My room was rather small and there was no safe for storing valuables during the day.  One day there was no hot water in the morning at all which was horrible!  However, for the price and the location, it's a safe, decent choice if you are travelling to Florence.  Breakfast was included and it was average.  My favorite amenity was the free WiFi.   Overall, if I had to stay here again, I wouldn't complain but it wouldn't be my first choice.

title: Very close to the train station, clean, great staff.
review: Good place. Warm welcome,  location near train station, near supermarket. room big and comfortable.

title: Cosy hotel in a convenient location
review: We had a triple room that was very spacious.  Bathroom was clean and large with a tub.  Not the most updated hotel around, but for the price it was excellent.  We were supposed to stay the the Rex Hotel, owned by the same operators, but our room there had a leak in the ceiling so they put us up here.  Location is 1 block from the train station.  Front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant.  Breakfast included was average.  Free wifi.  They held our luggage in a room for 6 hours on our last day there which was great.  Would defintely stay here again. Great value for the price.

title: an ideally located hotel
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great location
review: This Hotel is close to the Florence railway station and at the entrance to old Florence. It is excellently located and has a old charm of the 300 hundred year old hotel (well the clerk says the hotel was built in the 17th century). Its not a grand hotel, but is comfortable and just is really well located. Restaurants and shops are a 2 minute walk away.  The rooms were large enough with good bedding and nice bathrooms. Breakfast is pleasant continental fair but not a wide selection. However Florence is such a beautiful city that you dont spend any time in the hotel. I recommend this hotel, I would stay there again.

title: Wonderful old world hotel with all the amenities of the modern.
review: Fantastic location , 3 min walk to duomo 2 mins from train station . Probably one of the best standards of accomodation in florence without paying ridiculous amounts of money . Staff lovely .

title: Nice place
review: So close to the train station made this a wonderful choice and the fact that it was also right by the hop-on, hop-off bus stop was a bonus.  Easy walk to everything we wanted to see in Florence and safely nestled on a street that was a bit slower than the others nearby.  Boutiques and street fairs close by - loads of restaurants and within walking distance of the meeting points of many tours.  We were delighted by the friendly staff and clean, private room.  Spacious but no wasted room.  Adequate for several days while on holiday.  Good value.

title: Great location Poor Hotel
review: The hotel is quite centrally located and under 10 mins walk from the train station and within walking distance to many of Florence's main "attractions". The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Very courteous, they also helped us decide suitable day to visit PISA which was on our itinerary . We made a day visit to Pisa and were glad that the hotel staff recommended best option to travel instead of opting a tour . They can improve their breakfast spread but honestly by then My husband and I had quite stop complaining about the quality of breakfast being served in France and Italy :)  rooms , they should consider improving/ refurbishing, rest all is good .

title: Average hotel but very centrally located
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Convenient and clean
review: The main advantages were proximity to the train station and the Duomo and free unlimited wifi.  Other than that the hotel was very average.  It's ok for a short stay 1 to 2 days, it's not very modern and breakfast was not good, breakfast staff were unhelpful.  Still if you're going to be out sightseeing most of the time, it's very centrally located and please do consider it.

title: Great location, helpful staff
review: This hotel is in a very good location - a few minutes from Santa Maria Novella station and five minutes to the centre of Florence. It's clean and quite comfortable but a little down at heel. Staff were fine and breakfast was satisfactory. Good value generally.

title: Fantastic location
review: San Georgio And Olympic proved a very good choice for my stay for two nights in Florence this July. The hotel scores on location, price, comfort, breakfast and a friendly and efficient staff. In a city like Florence which has to be experienced on foot, what more does one want? While functionally modern, it also has some quaint features that befit Florence.  The Santa Maria Novella train station is a three-minute walk, the Duomo five minutes away and the cluster of Uffizi Gallery, Ponte Vecchio, Museo Galili as well as Accademia within a radius of 15 to 20 minutes of leisurely walk. Perfect location.  Book in advance and you'll find the price reasonable for Florence where hotel rates are comparatively high.  The entrance is spacious and decorous though fading somewhat. The coffee…

title: Good location, helpful staff, great air-con!
review: We booked a cheap 4 day/3 night break with Broadway Travel for £130 each including flights and couldn't have been happier with what we got. The location is fantastic, just 5 minutes from the station and close to all the major attractions. Our room was clean although a little tired in places but the sheets were crisp and white and that counts for a lot with me. The breakfast was a selection of juices, yoghurt, fruit, cereals, rolls, meat and cheese with tea or coffee and was ample to set you up for the day. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside was that our room was on the 1st floor at the front and there was a fair bit of noise at night with people walking past shouting and laughing. They offered to move us the very next day as soon as they had a spare room but…

title: Great, stylish, perfect location, definatly recommend!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: fantastic location and value!
review: Hotel is in the heart of the city like a small palace! 5 min to the train station.  lovely design in room and in reception area, homey,cosy atmosphere. Great breakfast and the best coffe in all town! clen room and bathroom, comfortable bed. Polite,helpful and caring attitude from staff at the reception. Highly recommend! I just want to come back!

title: Fairly basic with limited frills
review: Dear sirs,                we thank you very much for your nice review.  You will be always welcome in our Hotels.

title: Good location
review: myself and my partner stayed at the San Giorgio for 4 nights in July and we had a very enjoyable stay.    First of all the hotel's location is great, under 10 mins walk from the train station and within walking distance to many of Florence's main "attractions". The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.   We had to move rooms when we arrived due to noisy building work next door and the staff were happy to move us and did so very quickly.  Our 2nd room was actually bigger so that was a bonus! Our room was basic and in need of a refurb', but it was clean and comfortable.  the hotel breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice.  Overall i would recommend this hotel.   Helpful and friendly staff, great location, clean and comfortable.

title: Very good location
review: Dear sirs,                we thank you very much for your nice review.  You will be always welcome in our Hotels.

title: Perfect location, nothing fancy, very comfortable
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: central location, comfortable stay
review: The final stage of our honeymoon was in Florence - where we stayed at the San Giorgio, which is a 5 minute walk from the train station, in a quiet back street. The location is perfect, as you can walk to the Duomo in 5 minutes, and the Ponte Vecchio bridge in 10 minutes.   On arrival we were told that we had been booked in to a twin room but it was no problem at all to transfer us to a double room. For a city hotel on a budget, the room was more than big enough, with a good bathroom and the added bonus of a balcony too.   Breakfast was more than adequate and the staff were always on hand to help if you had a question. Great hotel to relax and enjoy Florence from.

title: It really needs to be refurbished
review: Set a 2 minute walk from the station and a 5 min walk from the central attractions this was location perfect.  The hotel generally looks somewhat tired and could do with some upgrading in parts.  Hotel staff were efficient, but not engaging - a complete contrast to our experience in Venice.  We had a family room - it was large and clean and the beds were comfotable, although the windows were very difficult to open without fear of breaking them.  Breakfast was very basic, but plentiful.  In such an expensive city it met our needs.

title: Don't stay in Room 381
review: When my husband and I arrived to the hotel we notice that the décor and furniture of the room looked tired, but we were fine with it because the hotel is very close to the main attractions, the room looked clean and the staff seem friendly. The problem was that when I took a shower, the shower's door didn't close properly and the water went through, making all the floor wet. I told to the person in reception, but he just said to me that he was alone and couldn't leave the reception to come and have a look, so offered to me to go to a closet somewhere close my room and take clean towels and put them on the bathroom floor. The following days, I keep doing it but apart from it, the rest of our  the stay was fine.

title: Clean, simple, affordable and excellent location!
review: This hotel is near the station and the Duomo which is great when you have had to journey from Pisa Airport.  We were given room 381 which was dirty, smelly with  wall paper hanging off the wall and suspicious stains on the carpet and the oldest TV in Europe.  After complaining we were offered another room which was comfortable and clean with a much better view.  The staff varied enormously some were offhand while others were very helpful- so beware and if the hairdryer in your room does not work they have one behind the reception desk. For a short trip to Florence at a reasonable price it is ok. Just remember to complain if you get room 381.

title: only one star not 3
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: a fair hotel - you get what you pay for.
review: very dissapointing hotel, i got the worst room with no fridge, tiny tv, uncomfortable as i could feel the mattress springs on my back and no heater was working untill the hotel switched it on on certain times,  staff  was unhelpful. The only good thing is the location ..... i wont come back to this hotel!

title: Good depending on what room you get!
review: my wife and i decided on a long weekend to florence and found this hotel on the internet. flew into pisa and took the train on to florence. very well situated from the railway station. on arrival, we found the staff very friendly and welcoming. the room itself was a good size but looking a little dated with a rather boring view onto a roof and tiny courtyard. the breakfast were the usual continental fayre, but the coffee was below standard (in the italian sense). all in all, an acceptable hotel unless you are looking for 4 or 5 star luxury.

title: Wonderful location, a bit faded but very clean, staff amazingly helpful
review: Arrived early March. Very good hotel location and very close to Railway station and connections from Pisa.  First room we had was terrible, White stain on the bed, dirty mirror, old bathroom.  Complained and was shown two other rooms, much better. Lots of reviews on here seem to vary depending on the Rooney and it certainly does vary!  Get a nice room and it's all down to luck, youll be fine, a bad room you will be complaining!  Have fun!

title: Close location to train station
review: This hotel could scarcely have been in a better location........ 5 minutes leisurely walk to the Duomo, 10 to the Uffizi and the Ponte Vecchio.  And just around the corner from the wonderful S. Maria Novella church/square and the main railway station. True, the place could benefit from a spruce up.... the wallpaper is peeling off in many places, there are scuff marks on the walls and definite signs of wear on the carpets.  The bedroom furniture is slightly shabby and the televisions are very old fashioned.  The bathrooms have also definitely seen better days,  but everything was scrupulously clean and the down at heel interiors were more than made up for by the pleasant and helpful staff.  I was travelling with an elderly lady who became very ill.  They were extremely…

title: Very well positioned!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: #1 for location and on a budget
review: This was my second stay at San Giorgio Hotel (first stayed in 2005). The hotel has a convenient location at the beginning of a very narrow street, being located walking distance from Duomo (4-5 min) and very close to the Santa Maria Novella train station (2-3 min) and SITA bus station for regional day trips (quite hidden in the courtyard of a building just opposite the train station). Taxi from Peretola airport takes you probably 15-20 minutes at a flat price of EUR 22 + bags charge. Although located close to the train station, there area seemed quite safe as long as you behave properly.  The hotel is an old fashion type building, similar as the almost all other hotels that can be found within the historical center (some of them even looked poorer when saw them from the…

title: Lifesaver considering road conditions and cab availability upon our arrival.
review: We stayed here in September 2010 only for 1 night.  The hotel was very easy to find, it was a simple 5 minute walk from the train station. The location of the hotel is great. You are only a few minutes walk from anywhere in Florence and the little cobbled streets are like a maze, so you can get lost if you really wanted to.  We got a twin classic room, Room #111. The room was not huge, but still an ok size for a European Hotel. The bathroom was ok for the standard of hotel it is. The light wasn't working, so I told the reception and they sent someone up to replace it - no big issue. I am not too sure if the air conditioning was working as the next morning our room was very hot and stuffy, but we still got a good night sleep. Our room faced the inside of the hotel, so when we…

title: Lovely spacious room in this price range
review: We arrived in Florence the day after the "huge" snowstorm of December 2010. The streets, sidewalks, everything were covered in snow making walking, especially with suitcases, quite difficult. The line at the taxi stand was two blocks long. We were heading in town to a place closer to the sites that had availability. When we crossed the street and saw this hotel, we decided to inquire about rooms. They offered us a double for 65 euros, which seemed like a good price to me.   The hotel was clean and in good condition. Even though we'd already checked out, they let us hang out in lobby after a hard day of sight seeing and soggy cold feet while we waited until dinner. Then, after dinner we came back until we needed to leave to catch our night train to Vienna.   Given the…

title: A nice friendly Hotel...
review: This was about our 7th Hotel on our whirlwind tour of Europe. By this stage we were really tired and just wanted to unwind.  It was great to have a big King bed in a quiet room at the back of the Hotel. We enjoyed the breakfast here alot, there was a great selection of cereal meats and breads and excellent coffee. For those travelling by Euro Rail this is a top choice as it is so close to the Station and easy walking distance to the Markets, Duomo Cathedral and other famous sights. The free wifi lounge was great and very cozy, a good chance to chat to fellow travellers. A few doors along from the Hotel entrance is a Restaurant Regina and its attached deli, we ate there each day and night the food was so amazing. We would stay here again for sure.

title: If you are a tall person, bathroom won't suit....
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: A Very good hotel in it's price range
review: The paper thin walls let all kinds of sounds transfer between the bathroom of the adjacent room and ours;  the configuration of the bathroom was such that knees touched the shower wall; the carpet was old and we were glad to have had slippers; the room faced a pigeon covered roof and ventilation shaft.  Staff were great, breakfast was more than adequate. Would look for something else next time....

title: Beautiful hotel, great staff and excellent location
review: We stayed here during mid September 2010 and the staff were very helpful. Breakfasts were good and filling (lousy fruit juice though) balanced by excellent coffee. It is very centrally located but within easy distance to rail and bus terminus, and within walking distance to just about anywhere in Florence. Rooms were clean and serviced daily, the bathroom more than adequate and we highly recommend - we will stay when we visit Florence during October 2011 - well done San Giorgio!

title: Excellent location and price
review: You won't be disappointed, this is a great hotel.  We had a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking the Arno River.  This hotel is 1/2 block from the Ponte Vecchio bridge in a perfect location.  So easy to walk everywhere in this beautiful, clean, safe city.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and the complementary breakfast was the best we had in any of the hotels in our 2 weeks in Italy.

title: Not bad, not great...just way too warm!!!
review: This small hotel is very well located in Florence.  It was clean and the staff were very helpful in every way. I would definitely stay there again.  It is close to the train/bus station, so is very easy to get to.

title: Fantastic value for money - and spacious !
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Very decent hotel & great location
review: We stayed here in November 2007.  Of all the hotels we stayed at in October and November 2007, this was by far the most spacious, clean by our standards and the location of everything was fantastic ! Unfortunately, I was unable to choose '2007' in the options available for this review - but I really wanted to add our review to this website. After several weeks of travelling, this hotel was our 'respite' and we enjoyed relaxing in our large room.  It seems we may have been lucky because after reading other reviews on this website, it appears the rooms vary considerably.  Anyways, we have booked to stay here in December for 4 nights, and we're hoping we get another great spacious room. Ah, and yes - the room was very quiet !!

title: Dirty and falling apart
review: We liked the hotel , even  though the rooms were pretty small ( double bed deluxe room ). It is 5 mins walk from florence santa maria novella station. everything is nearby , even Mcdonalds. All the hop on buses are available near the hotel until 11 pm. Staff is very helpful and kind. Breakfast is Ok not much variety. One can stay there definitely if travelling with restricted budget.

title: helped organize accomodations= family from 2 continents for my wedding
review: The San Giorgio in Florence has a great location close the to main station and close to the inner city. It is an ideal place to explore the city from. WiFi is free in the lounge room at the entrance and the service is okay. But unfortunately, these are the only positive things to say about this hotel.   Their website is completely misleading. Kudos to the photographer who managed to capture it in such a good light. From the the pictures, you might expect simple rooms with antique furniture, but it's just old and worn there. Our room was literally falling apart. The TV didnt work, a desk lamp collapsed, the blankets and the carpet were grey stained. Boards were coming off the doors and the floor. Everything in the room was damaged somehow and was in need of renovation. The room…

title: Perfect Location!
review: I worked with several employees of the hotel, in particular Olivier, who helped plan accomodations beginning 5 months in advance. wedding planning is confusing and tiring in and of itself but they offered us good prices, comfortable accomodations and flexible arrivals/departure dates and last minute changes...our group was about 25 people!!!

title: Hard to beat the convenience
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Fantastic Base - Fantastic City
review: We stayed here two years ago and had no hesitation coming back. The staff were welcoming and helpful; the room suitable for a 3 star hotel and although breakfast was busy the food and service were perfectly adequate. Every dish was refilled regularly. It's important to be patient. The location of this hotel is convenient to trains and buses and to many significant sites that visitors wish to see.

title: San Giorgio brand, unreal experience
review: My wife and I visited Florence and stayed at the San Giorgio & Olimpic for 3 days. We took the Terravision bus from Pisa (you should pre-book to avoid the scrum to get on the bus!) and arrived in Florence 80 minutes later.  The San Giorgio is a 5 minute walk from the Santa Maria Novella Train Station (where the bus stops), and the hotel is at the entrance of a side street just off the square.  The hotel was very clean and we were taken to our room (520) which was extremely spacious with 2 beds pushed together and a bed settee. There was a spacious wardrobe, a TV, a cabinet and a mini fridge. The bathroom was very clean and the room was cleaned daily.   Reception duties were split between a few staff and we found Piero the most helpful and friendly, although there were no…

title: Convenient location, great value!
review: If you think to visit Florence think twice which hotel you want to choose. I have visited Florence by the end of February in a vacation, and stayed only 4 days. I've experienced the lowest temperature inside of a hotel. It is a glace hotel with only a ventilation system, not worming system. It is very well located, quiet, but with limited breakfast variety, no wireless coverage inside the chambers. I am not talking about the price, I am talking about the comfort of a 3 stars hotel. I am sorry, but i will never choose again this hotel. Chris.

title: Firenze heart with good rates
review: We stayed for a week in this hotel and, although fairly basic, it represented great value for money. Our room was large, quiet, clean and comfortably furnished.  The bathroom was spacious, very clean with bath (shower over), large handbowl, loo and bidet.  Lots of hot water and fresh towels, toiletries and loo rolls were provided daily. The buffet breakfast was more than adequate with a choice of cereals, yogurts, croissant, rolls, biscuits, cheese, hams, jams, basket of dried fruit and walnuts, etc. plus big jars of tinned peach halves and delicious prunes!  Lots of choices of teas or fresh coffee. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located for the rail and bus station and is only a short walk into the centre of Florence.  There are lots of…

title: If you are on a tight budget, go for it!!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great Location Friendly Staff
review: It's cheap and it's conveniently located near Stazione Santa Maria Novella BUT that's where the good bits end.  The hotel's own website states that, "A family run hotel the hotel is kept in very good condition and rennovated periodically in order to maintain the high standards it has always set."  I don't know when was the last time they renovated the hotel because we felt like we were staying in the Colosseum, i.e. everything was falling apart!  The furniture in the room was old; there was no safe; even some dinning room fittings were broken.  The hotel is not very clean either.  The bed-side tables and drawers in the room were dusty; I guess they didn't bother to clean it regularly and no guests dare to use them.  The first morning when we went into the dinning room, I…

title: Good Hotel
review: I am from Portland, Oregon and my girlfriend is from Munich, Germany. We had a great stay in Florence thanks in part to the hotel San Giorgio. The staff is very helpful and made our stay as pleasant as possible. For the cost the hotel is a great value because of its great location, breakfast included and free wifi throughout the hotels main lobbies on each floor. Florence is close to a river and this results in the area having many mequitos which we encountered in our room as well. The rooms are clean for Italian standards. If the tempature is hot the hotel will turn on the air conditioning at their discreation. Breakfast is served in a nice lounge downstairs with crossiants, cereal, rolls, yogurt,  ham, orange juice and the coffee is great. Would recommend staying here.

title: Great location, friendly helpful staff, very tired-looking bedroom!
review: Our triple room was quite,  clean and spacious.  The attached bath was up two stairs,  clean and supplied with fresh towels and toiletries.  The cold buffet breakfast was okay.  The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful.  Its location is great.  Five minutes walking distance from the main railway station and also from the Duomo, Uffizi and other sights.

title: Comfortable accomodation with helpful & friendly service in excellent location
review: Can't fault the staff at the front desk who were very helpful and encouraging when I tried out my dreadful italian! Fortunately they all spoke english far better than I spoke italian.  The main lobby and lounge are nice enough. WiFi is free in the hotel. Strongest signal is in the lounge but I managed to upload photos to facebook from my room on the second floor.  Breakfast was good - it's buffet-style (as seems to be the norm in the parts of Italy I've visited) and pretty good quality....cereals, pastries, bread, meats, cheeses and yoghurts.  Our room left a bit to be desired - the wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the carpet was a bit worn and dirty (more through age than anything else) and the shower-room was pretty basic. It was a quiet room though, facing onto the…

title: Mixed reviews...perhaps should check out a few more places!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: This hotel is the best
review: We stayed at the San Giorgio for 3 nights recently and were disappointed.  Our room was only sparingly cleaned and the carpet was worn and dirty (would not walk on carpet without footwear).  I was disappointed that the online photos depicted a quaint little hotel with nice antiques but in reality, I found it to be a hotel  full of worn and tired furniture.  From the pro side, the staff were accommodating to guests and the location of the hotel was excellent. Given my time back, I would have preferred to pay a little more and feel more comfortable from a cleanliness standpoint.

title: Crappy hotel, nice location
review: Home away from home. We bought 2 bottles of chianti around the corner from the hotel and drank it in the loungeroom on our arrival from Parma. The hotel staff were very obliguing providing glasses. The rooms were great, clean and comfy.The hotel has a LIFT!! This is unheard of in budget hotels. The staff are brilliant. The breakfast's amazing and there is a parking station next door. 3 mins to station. Everything is within walking distance. Everyone speaks fluent English. What more could you want? Stay there, you won't be disappointed, the price is great also.

title: Solid Hotel, close to Train Terminal and Historic Center of Town
review: Spent two nights in San Giorgio e Olimpic with my fiance. The location of the hotel is functional, especially for travellers using trains. During check-in, the service in the lobby was friendly, but the room was a big disappoinment, to say the least.   The carpet in the room was dirty and stained and was not vacuumed after previous guests. We also had lots of mold in the bathroom walls and the air was stale. Electrical wires were hanging from the lamps. The window was a bit loose, so every morning we woke up to the sound of window clattering.   Overall, the room was very dirty, uncomfortable and impractical. It would seriously need cleaning from floor to roof. Hotel San Giorgio is inexpensive, but that's no excuse for the overall dirtiness. I've been in many one-star-motels…

title: Average hotel.
review: We traveled to Florence by train, so being a 5 minute walk from the station was a bonus. It is only a few minute walk to the Duomo, restaurants and shopping.  The Hotel is solid with a friendly staff at the front desk and for breakfast. The front desk also called to book a one day Tuscany Tour for us as well. The room was large including a closet and a tub with shower. Interior worn, but serviceable for a 3 star Hotel. Good Value.

title: Great location, basic/ good value
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Highly recommended
review: My wife and I have just spent 3 nights at the San Giorgio for a short break in Florence.  This hotel was just what we were looking for (ie. good price within a short walk of most of the main attractions).  We really enjoyed Florence and within a short time we were able to put the street map away and just wander around.   We saw most of the main attractions and walked for miles around the city - best way to explore. We would happily use this hotel again.

title: Ideal location for train travelers
review: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and found everything very satisfactory. In particular, the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast was quite adeequate but would not satisfy someobody looking for the full cholesterol  egg and bacon experience . The room was clean and serviced daily. The lounge is very comfortable.
