The position of the hotel could hardly be better - very near the station but within a few minutes' walk of the tourist area.. The great Zsa Zsa restaurant is at the end of the road.

title: great place to stay
review: If you're travelling around by train, dont hesitate in picking up this hotel. Its just a 3 minute walk from the Santa Maria Novella station, which makes difference when you arrive with more 5 people and 6 bags and dont need taxi or anything. Also we constantly went to the station to check prices and timetable for our daytrips to Siena and Pisa, once Florence is a great base but you dont have much to do there in 2 days, you gotta travel around!!  Please notice that the hotel is also very central and easy walking distance to the Duomo and other attractions, including lots of shops, a cheap internet cafe around the corner, cheap supermarket and a mc donalds just half block away.  Breakfast nice, with tones of yorgut, very big rooms, ok bathrooms, and a coomon room with sofas and…

title: a dump
review: We stayed in this hotel for 11 days, and everythin was perfect.  First day we were provided with a little bit smaller room, because all another 3bed rooms were ocupated - but just the day after , they asked us if we want to move in a better room - cause it was possible.  They are all so kind and friendly - and the prise was also very good.  I will recomand this hotel to all young people - and the families [--] well...

title: Don't believe their pictures and publicity
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Great Location
review: Booked this hotel through an agent who, as it turns out hadn't visited for over a year and thought the hotel had been refurbished. We were disgusted at the first room and contacted the agent who arranged another room. We were given the keys to two rooms. Both slightly better, if you consider that the wall socket was loose, the furniture was damaged and dangerous. the toilet roll holder was hanging off. The wall paper was peeling. The paint  appeared to have been applied by a young child. The general aroma of the hotel was....The room had an ashtray when we expected a non smoking room. The breakfast was mediocre. Three stars, certainly not. Our next hotel in Rome was three star and like a palace by comparison. They both cost exactly the same tariff.  The staff were friendly. The…

title: Just Awful. Don't stay here.
review: This was a good hotel in a great location.  We walked there from the train station easily, pulling luggage.  Staff was helpful, had an elevator, decent breakfast. etc.  There was an internet cafe and a laundromat very close.  There was construction on a street about 100 yds away, which made the area seem kind of bad, but that was temporary, and the area is fine.

title: The best stay in Firenze
review: We arrived to find the lift out of order and the receptionist moaning about the fact that we didn't have the booking confirmation to hand (it was in my luggage which was being dragged upstairs by some unfortunate porter). He moaned about this on subsequent occasions, including once when we arrived back at the hotel late one night to find him and a number of his cronies clearly drunk. He was obnoxious and the atmosphere was intimidating. The room was dirty, cold and generally in poor condition with  broken furniture and an ancient and noisy aircon system.  "Breakfast" was inedible. The hotel is located in a an area of the city which has a somewhat seedy flavour with God knows what  transactions taking place in dark  corners. This is, allegedly, a three star hotel, however, it is…

title: Below expectation
review: We were recommended this hotel by an Italian conference organization group (Consultia Umbria) as we were attending a week long conference at the Fortezza di Basso.  The location of this hotel could not be more fantastic.  A 7 minute walk to the train station, minutes from the Duomo, San Lorenzo church, seconds from the world-famous open air market and a lovely walk from the Ponte Vecchio and the Boboli Gardens.  It was a pleasant 10-15 minute walk to our conference center in the morning.  It was safe, secure, and the breakfast was absolutely amazing.  There is a woman who greets you with a "buongiorno" and asks if you'd like cafe.  Say yes, and savor the most amazing cafe latte you'll ever have!  The breakfast included orange juice, yogurt, cereals, meats, fresh fruit,…

title: Good location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Good location, bad aura
review: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel.  If you travel by train, this hotel is located in an ideal location.  You don't have to drag your luggages too far off from the train station. It's also very near to all the places of interest.  The room is an acceptable size and bathroom, though small but it's acceptable.  Served good breakfast and they are nice to serve us earlier as we have an early train to catch.  Don't expect too much help from the front desk.

title: Grest, Except for the staff
review: Indeed, a great location. Otherwise, more of a disappointment. We were told that the hotel does not have non-smoking rooms. Our room just reeked. Not much of a view: construction and scaffolding.  Instead of fresh air, you would get the smell of construction. Dingy bathroom.   Our room was at the end of a long corridor that is dark most of the time. Motion sensors are supposed to turn the lights on, but in reality they lag behind if you walk fast. So you better be careful.

title: lovely place
review: We stayed in San Giorgio e Olimpic for three nights;  the location was very good, close to the train station, very good restaurants and the Mercatto Centrale.  Main attractions in Florence were also at walking distance, like uffizzi, academia, Duomo, etc.  Breakfast was very good, the room was large and clean, with a nice view.  Our only complain is the staff; not friendly at all, the woman serving coffee in the breakfast room looked awfully depressed, and we asked for wake up calls that never happened.  When we asked them for help with bus routes, they seemed to get upset, and told us to walk instead.  Overall, good.

title: Loved this hotel
review: Great place, wonderful staff.  Clean and spacious room , with a balcony overlooking the duomo.

title: find somewhere else
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Greta Location but grotty and dirty
review: what a place, very conviently located for all that florence has to offer, we booked a room for 3 (all adults) small dark dingy room, light from a window onto a wall, mouldy bathroom walls (didnt bother having a shower) and the toilet could be viewed from the corridor opposite (in the end we had to leave the light out for any privacy).  breakfast was ok but once it was gone there were not replacements.  on the whole not good.

title: Left after the first night
review: Just returned from Florence which is fantastic, the only let down was this hotel.  Although the hotel is fantastically located, it is so dirty.  Several cobwebs hung down from the ceiling lamps, the wall paper is dirty, all in all this hotel needs to be redecorated and by no means be 3 star.

title: In just the right place
review: My wife and I traveled to Florence for our tenth anniversary.  Having previously enjoyed trips both Rome and Venice, we were really looking forward to a nice stay in Florence.  The hotel is conveniently located very close to the train station in Florence, within an easy walking distance.  It is easy to find.  The entrance was typical for hotels in Florence and elsewhere in Italy.  We checked in just at sundown, and were shown to the room.  When we entered the room, it was musty smelling and dirty.  The furniture and bedspread were covered by dust, the carpet was in need of a good vacuuming.  The bathroom was partially clean, but the tub/shower was infested with mildew.  When I asked for another room, I was informed the hotel was full, but perhaps they could change the room…

title: fabulous florence
review: This hotel is in an ideal place, near the station and a stone's throw from the centre of the city. Little shops nearby where you can buy food and drink, good choice of places to eat as well. A pleasant building, nice sitting area downstairs where we often cooled off. Air conditioning in the rooms excellent. Comfy beds as well. Rooms were a good size, we had two which faced  away from the street so it was very quiet, hard to believe we were in the centre of Florence. Hot showers variable, sometimes hot and sometimes not. Room 116 has a nasty damp patch on the bathroom ceiling and you do need to fix this please managment as it smells bad. Staff always courteous, breakfast in a nice room and plenty for our needs. We would stay here again, it was great to just walk out of the door…

title: Great location
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Wonderful location
review: A great centrally located hotel in the heart of Florence and within walking distance to all the major attractions.  If arriving by train the train station is literally across the road and if flying into Florence Airport it takes about 20 minutes in a taxi and costs about 15 Euros.  The rooms were of an average standard and very clean.  The buffet breakfast was okay but nothing special.  The staff were very friendly and spoke very good English.  All in all a very nice hotel and I would recommend this to anyone wishing to go to this amazing city.

title: It's close to everything!
review: This was one of our favorite hotels during our trip to Italy.  The quad room looked exactly like the picture on their website.  The room and hotel were clean, the room spacious. The desk clerks weren't overly friendly, but I wouldn't call them rude either.  Air-conditioning was a relief after going without in other cities.  It is within walking distance of all the major attractions.

title: Standing Up for the Sanny G.
review: We stayed at the San Giorgio in late Nov. 2004. It was very convenient with the bus only a few steps away, and just a short walk from the train station. It was average in looks and decor, but there was a light breakfast each morning to get you started. And I agree with the other reviewer that you had to practically beg the front desk staff to give you a map or act friendly. They were sort of "aloof".   We had just come from Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Napolean. They had been very friendly at that hotel and greeted us by name every day, so we were somewhat put off by the bland hospitality at the San G.   However they did come to our rescue when we went on to Venice and discovered that we had left our nice digital camera hanging on a chair back in the room. We called them…

title: You can find something better!
review: San Lorenzo’s lively merchants shout out from behind stalls with an array of products in one of the most traditional neighborhoods in Florence. Different ethnic groups join together in the large outdoor market of San Lorenzo and in the Central Market, a vast multi-floored building. Visitors are bound to fall in love with this area and in particular, with its variety of food, especially those focusing on Florentine dishes as well as international selections. Nobody leaves San Lorenzo without a shopping bag in hand or with an empty stomach.

title: Simple but Kind
review: Hi! I stayed at the San Giorgio and Olympic Hotel, Florence, this July 2005 with my husband and baby. Its location is good,near places of interest as well as the train station. Breakfast is good. However, ALL RECEPTIONISTS are rather rude and not helpful at all!!!!!!!! You have to literally beg them to give you a map of the city (though they are free!). The hotel has no parking area, so think twice if you'll rent a car because you have to pay 20 euros extra per day!!!! The hotel is in a driving-restricted area, so it took us 3 hours to find the hotel! Overall our stay was not very pleasant at this hotel, I'd stay somewhere else if I visited Florence again in the future.

title: Disappointing & Dingy
review: Great location only a few minutes walk from the main railway station in Florence this hotel is the perfect base from which to enjoy the many sights Florence has to offer. The hotel is very reasonably priced (given the rates some of the other hotels in the area were charging) and the staff are very friendly especially Piero who helped us with suggestions for good restaurants, pubs and general sightseeing information. I will definately be returning here!
